commit_message:
Adds doc8 check to pep8

This patch adds doc8 check for .rst files to pep8.
Files that fail doc8 check are also fixed.

Ignore D001 of doc8 check. This requires lot of changes and
should be done in a separated patch.

Change-Id: I7732abc55ec27026efbf56663ba02ff27e8ec847

commit_message:
Increase test stability of backup RBAC tests

This is to increase test stability of backup RBAC tests which
fail not only due to the rather error-prone nature of backing
up volumes, but also because of data race conditions and
missing clean ups.

This adds some waiters following certain backup actions. This
also adds a clean up of the volume that is created when restoring
a backup [0].

Additional waiters are also added for waiting for volumes to
become available following backup (because they briefly
go into backing-up status) [1].

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html#restore-a-backup
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569917/8

Change-Id: Ifce15f69fcca38005b40785c42231ca164917345

  vif_plug_noop.noop

Change ba61a981171b3514219eb6ecf306e421f99ce127 added the noop plugin

(cherry picked from commit 7e73f50cc5c85eb208a8ade6d5daec878b217465)

commit_message:
Add vif_plug_noop to setup.cfg packages

The following error is being seen in the gate n-cpu logs:

  ERROR stevedore.extension [-] Could not load 'noop': No module named
  vif_plug_noop.noop

Change ba61a981171b3514219eb6ecf306e421f99ce127 added the noop plugin
but missed adding it to the packages list.

Closes-Bug: #1783403

Change-Id: If4816a63cb19c4b593a6994a3a9fe05a2196761d
(cherry picked from commit 7e73f50cc5c85eb208a8ade6d5daec878b217465)

commit_message:
Use global ansible.cfg for nodes-uuid playbook

Previously we tried setting from within the Ceph service some Ansible
settings before launching the nodes-uuid playbook; we should instead
just point to the global ansible.cfg file.

Also includes setting environment variables not in the ansible.cfg.

Co-Authored-By: John Fulton <fulton@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1782423
Change-Id: Id220ebba5d9881eae943c7459b2328d3384b7370

commit_message:
Update swift for replication issues

There are corresponding ansible changes to go with these image
changes - add nc to swift image, and create dir for lock files.

nc allows for rsync replication to easily target {{ swift_rsync_port }}

change the lock file location for swift user to access - see bug
for more details.

Change-Id: I78826aeee35601ff65cbe50932482ef2f68346ae
Closes-Bug: #1733851
(cherry picked from commit f7b453d95b9ce3efd45071134b143712b879f98e)

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I9c74760d919dd9908da976b3a2558ee786749b84

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: If143f19cbcedc5c819bf7c7e1ac8076323699b82

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 03:29:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for failure in cleaning in iRMC driver

This patch will fix an issue for BIOS configuration
during combine out-of-band an in-band in manual clean.

The cleaning operation will be fail, if an in-band clean step were to
execute after the completion of out-of-band clean step that
performs reboot of the node. This fixing is following other patch [1]
from Shivanand.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580136/

Tested on TX2540 M1 Fujitsu servers successfully.
Co-authored-By: Dao Cong Tien <tiendc@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I0b37b93851cc56141c2fe78793296c50ad25f9ad
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for failure in cleaning in iRMC driver

This patch will fix an issue for BIOS configuration
during combine out-of-band an in-band in manual clean.

The cleaning operation will be fail, if an in-band clean step were to
execute after the completion of out-of-band clean step that
performs reboot of the node. This fixing is following other patch [1]
from Shivanand.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580136/

Tested on TX2540 M1 Fujitsu servers successfully.
Co-authored-By: Dao Cong Tien <tiendc@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I0b37b93851cc56141c2fe78793296c50ad25f9ad

commit_message:
deploy-steps: switch to tripleo_role_name

"role_name" is internal to Ansible, we should not use it.
This patch uses the new variable set in the inventory to use a specific
TripleO var: tripleo_role_name which is the TripleO role name and not
the Ansible role names, both things are very different.

Depends-On: I57c4eac87e2f96dfe5490b111cd2508505715d56
Change-Id: Iecaf6f1b830e65be2f9e2e44431054fe46f9f565
Related-Bug: #1771171
(cherry picked from commit 1bec01137eca33fa210daa044571629b6ff848b8)

commit_message:
Reflect multiattach deprecation in help text

Change Icbb9c0ca89b25620cedff6cac7a4723e7126eca6 notified that the
``multiattach`` argument was deprecated, but nothing was added to the
args help text to indicate this, relying on a user to have read the
release notes.

In preparation of removing this option, this updates the help text so
there is at least some indication that it is going away.

Change-Id: I9e767a3f1411fbfc0bf0e433b45560e451d547d5
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

messages:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 16:44:17.000000000', 'message': 'Remove replication v1 support

The replication v1 implementation in Cinder was deprecated in the Mitaka
release in favor of the v2 "Cheesecake" version. Support was kept in the
client for backwards compatibility, but it has now been several releases
and these options should be removed.

Closes-bug: #1705470

Change-Id: I978a39a552fffc9ac7ba6e4726d1df2072fa45ba
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove replication v1 support

The replication v1 implementation in Cinder was deprecated in the Mitaka
release in favor of the v2 "Cheesecake" version. Support was kept in the
client for backwards compatibility, but it has now been several releases
and these options should be removed.

Closes-bug: #1705470

Change-Id: I978a39a552fffc9ac7ba6e4726d1df2072fa45ba
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Include 'tripleo_role_name' in the inventory

"role_name" is internal to Ansible, we should not use it.
As a transition, include "tripleo_role_name" in the inventory and once
we're ready we'll remove our usage of "role_name", in a future patch.

Related-Bug: #1771171
Change-Id: I57c4eac87e2f96dfe5490b111cd2508505715d56
(cherry picked from commit 9ce1c075253900a7944531bcb8357082b481e34e)

[{'created': '2018-07-25 01:37:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a race when upgrading Neutron & Ironic on the undercloud

There is a race condition where Ironic Inspector upgrade removes the
service packages, which has in dependency Neutron as well so it will try
to remove Neutron at Step 2 while other Neutron services need to be
stopped by Ansible first, also at Step 2.
The packages removals happen at Step 3, so this patch moves these tasks
to it, like we do for other services.

Change-Id: Ic14f7837d8d11fd5260ba7c5236018c9a6226e5e
'}, {'created': '2018-07-25 01:40:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a race when upgrading Neutron & Ironic on the undercloud

There is a race condition where Ironic Inspector upgrade removes the
service packages, which has in dependency Neutron as well so it will try
to remove Neutron at Step 2 while other Neutron services need to be
stopped by Ansible first, also at Step 2.
The packages removals happen at Step 3, so this patch moves these tasks

Change-Id: Ic14f7837d8d11fd5260ba7c5236018c9a6226e5e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a race when upgrading Neutron & Ironic on the undercloud

There is a race condition where Ironic Inspector upgrade removes the
service packages, which has in dependency Neutron as well so it will try
to remove Neutron at Step 2 while other Neutron services need to be
stopped by Ansible first, also at Step 2.
The packages removals happen at Step 3, so this patch moves these tasks
to it, like we do for other services.

Change-Id: Ic14f7837d8d11fd5260ba7c5236018c9a6226e5e

commit_message:
Use only update/upgrade ansible queue instead

Related tripleo-common change:
https://review.openstack.org/562995

To avoid race between tripleo queue and ansible queue
we need to use inly ansible queue for update and upgrade

Change-Id: I39b5a1a154b10683ac0de85afd6bbadc3491192a
Partial-Bug: #1783798
(cherry picked from commit 3b197c09911997e0f7ff127deff892e064a58786)

subject: Remove Nose from tacker-horizon
messages:
[{'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-06-20 07:04:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-06-20 07:04:17.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bp/improve-horizon-testing'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-06-20 07:05:26.000000000', 'content': 'Topic bp/improve-horizon-testing removed'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-06-20 11:41:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Since Horizon is getting rid of nose (they already removed nose from the requirements and other places) and Tacker-Horizon doesn't actually use nose for testing (only set the nose's environment variable in tox), I think you can remove nose instead and complete the test cases using Django's testsuite. What do you think?

https://github.com/openstack/tacker-horizon/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=nose&type=

And the blueprint that you mentioned says:

* To not break any plugin we need to remove
  ``TEST_RUNNER = 'django_nose.NoseTestSuiteRunner'` from each plugin to
  be sure that it works without nose."}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-06-22 04:53:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Since Horizon is getting rid of nose (they already removed nose
 > from the requirements and other places) and Tacker-Horizon doesn't
 > actually use nose for testing (only set the nose's environment
 > variable in tox), I think you can remove nose instead and complete
 > the test cases using Django's testsuite. What do you think?
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/tacker-horizon/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=nose&type=
 > 
 > And the blueprint that you mentioned says:
 > 
 > * To not break any plugin we need to remove
 > ``TEST_RUNNER = 'django_nose.NoseTestSuiteRunner'` from each plugin
 > to
 > be sure that it works without nose.

I agree"}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-06-22 05:05:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-06-22 07:26:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-06-22 11:49:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-06-22 12:01:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-06-22 12:02:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-06-22 12:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

'}, {'created': '2018-07-25 19:04:49.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate [token] infer_roles=False

The option `[token] infer_roles=False` is being deprecated in
favor of always expanding role implications during token
validation.

Default roles depend on a chain of implied role assignments.
Ex: an admin user will also have the reader and member role.
By ensuring that all these roles will always appear on the
token validation response, we can improve the simplicity and
readability of policy files.

blueprint deprecated-as-of-rocky

Change-Id: Id36c5b8f6a92f5f3e42e4bcedc3e2dd64eaeb130
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate [token] infer_roles=False

The option `[token] infer_roles=False` is being deprecated in
favor of always expanding role implications during token
validation.

Default roles depend on a chain of implied role assignments.
Ex: an admin user will also have the reader and member role.
By ensuring that all these roles will always appear on the
token validation response, we can improve the simplicity and
readability of policy files.

blueprint deprecated-as-of-rocky

Change-Id: Id36c5b8f6a92f5f3e42e4bcedc3e2dd64eaeb130

I'm not sure we need to be able to specify a bug and a story at the same time. If we have multiple bugs / stories we can specify the decorator multiple times.

The only difference between the two really is the URL that is printed in the skip message.

The way I would do this is to have an optional extra argument which defines whether the specified bug id is a lp or a storyboard one.

Apart from that the code looks ok so if have a good reason for this implementation I'm ok with it."}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-02-21 09:12:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I think it can be happend to need to specify a bug and story at the same time. For example, when an issue is affected in both of launchpad projects and storyboard projects, we might specify both of them. But I think it's a special case. So, I feel it might be good to have a normal test in the unit test."}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-02-21 09:12:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-03-12 10:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-03-12 10:46:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

'}, {'created': '2018-07-11 02:57:07.000000000', 'message': 'Added storyboard integration to tempest.lib decorators

A new parameter is introduced to related_bug/skip_because
decorators called `bug_type` which takes in either 'launchpad'
(default for backward compatibility) or 'storyboard'. The
appropriate link for each tracking page is generated based off
this value and the 'bug' value.

This is useful for projects like Monasca Tempest plugin which
tracks issues on Storyboard. Also,  Storyboard is the new community
preferred place to track stories and bugs [0]. So Tempest
should provide projects with the ability to track bugs using it.

Note that Storyboard does **not** only track stories. It tracks
bugs too: "It all begins with a story. A story is a bug report or
proposed feature. Stories are then further split into tasks,
which affect a given project and branch."

Unit tests and releasenotes are included.

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/StoryBoard
[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/page/about

Co-Authored-By: Felipe Monteiro <felipe.monteiro@att.com>
Change-Id: Ic34208cfe997ceacdafd1ce122691b58a9778e78

commit_message:
Added storyboard integration to tempest.lib decorators

A new parameter is introduced to related_bug/skip_because
decorators called `bug_type` which takes in either 'launchpad'
(default for backward compatibility) or 'storyboard'. The
appropriate link for each tracking page is generated based off
this value and the 'bug' value.

This is useful for projects like Monasca Tempest plugin which
tracks issues on Storyboard. Also,  Storyboard is the new community
preferred place to track stories and bugs [0]. So Tempest
should provide projects with the ability to track bugs using it.

Note that Storyboard does **not** only track stories. It tracks
bugs too: "It all begins with a story. A story is a bug report or
proposed feature. Stories are then further split into tasks,
which affect a given project and branch."

Unit tests and releasenotes are included.

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/StoryBoard
[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/page/about

Co-Authored-By: Felipe Monteiro <felipe.monteiro@att.com>
Change-Id: Ic34208cfe997ceacdafd1ce122691b58a9778e78

commit_message:
Replacing get_vnc_console with get_remote_console after microversion 2.6

The compute os-getVNCConsole Action API is deprecated from the
Microversion 2.5, so we should change to use the new remote-consoles API
from Microversion 2.6

ref: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#get-vnc-console-os-getvncconsole-action-deprecated

Implements blueprint: clear-deprecated-api

Change-Id: Iecba937a25f52b5a35eb523d9da069408fd5dc6b

Just wondering why this attribute is prefixed with os_ when no other attributes are and also what does os_ mean?'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-07-26 05:20:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

> Just wondering why this attribute is prefixed with os_ when no
 > other attributes are and also what does os_ mean?

Sean,

There might be possibility that existing images might have hidden as custom property. So to distinguish existing properties we have decided to prefix this with os_. Also we have certain properties with prefixed as os_ for example os_distro. I guess os stands for operating system (or OpenStack).'}, {'account_id': 3031, 'date': '2018-07-26 06:39:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> > Just wondering why this attribute is prefixed with os_ when no
 > > other attributes are and also what does os_ mean?
 > 
 > Sean,
 > 
 > There might be possibility that existing images might have hidden
 > as custom property. So to distinguish existing properties we have
 > decided to prefix this with os_. Also we have certain properties
 > with prefixed as os_ for example os_distro. I guess os stands for
 > operating system (or OpenStack).

Well I think if you can't distinguish between a property and an attribute of an image that is a separate bug that needs to be fixed.
os_disto is a property that you can set on a image but it is not an attribute of an image.
Also when glance added the visibility attribute I don't think the fact that a image could have had a visibility property defined into account.

It just seems really confusing to have this one attribute of an image with os_ when all the other ones don't do this. eg disk_format, size, checksum etc."}, {'account_id': 18418, 'date': '2018-07-26 06:48:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> > > Just wondering why this attribute is prefixed with os_ when no
 > > > other attributes are and also what does os_ mean?
 > >
 > > Sean,
 > >
 > > There might be possibility that existing images might have hidden
 > > as custom property. So to distinguish existing properties we have
 > > decided to prefix this with os_. Also we have certain properties
 > > with prefixed as os_ for example os_distro. I guess os stands for
 > > operating system (or OpenStack).
 > 
 > Well I think if you can't distinguish between a property and an
 > attribute of an image that is a separate bug that needs to be
 > fixed.
 > os_disto is a property that you can set on a image but it is not an
 > attribute of an image.
 > Also when glance added the visibility attribute I don't think the
 > fact that a image could have had a visibility property defined into
 > account.
 > 
 > It just seems really confusing to have this one attribute of an
 > image with os_ when all the other ones don't do this. eg
 > disk_format, size, checksum etc.

I agree with Sam here. I'd prefer this to be consistent with the other attributes and drop the 'os_'. What if a user had an image with a property called os_hidden already? Granted it will be less likely, but the problem isn't solved."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-26 12:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Sam and Andy, thanks for your comments.  Always good to get the opinion of people not on the Glance project team, especially operators.

> Well I think if you can't distinguish between a property and an attribute of an image that is a separate bug that needs to be fixed.

There is no difference between a property and attribute of an image from the end user point of view.  The "flat" json image response was introduced when the Images API v2 debuted in Folsom.  There were long, protracted discussions about segregating "core" from "custom" properties in the JSON when property protections were being designed (you can dig them up in the wiki and glance logs, probably). I lost that battle, the JSON response remained "flat".  So that is an intentional design decision, not a bug, and that ship sailed long ago.

> os_disto is a property that you can set on a image but it is not an attribute of an image.
> Also when glance added the visibility attribute I don't think the fact that a image could have had a visibility property defined into account.

Visibility was introduced with v2 in Folsom.  I wasn't involved in the discussions around property names differing between v1 and v2.  I'm not sure if a provision was made for migrating "old" properties or not.  The 'os_' prefix can be thought of as short for "openstack".

> It just seems really confusing to have this one attribute of an image with os_ when all the other ones don't do this. eg disk_format, size, checksum etc.

That's the trend we're taking when introducing new "system" properties.  Rocky will also see "os_hash_algo" and "os_hash_value", so it should get less confusing with time :)

> What if a user had an image with a property called os_hidden already? Granted it will be less likely, but the problem isn't solved.

That's a good point.  How likely is this?  I guess we could advise operators to crawl the DB and rename anything in the image_properties table (yes, to Sam's point, the DB knows the difference even though the API pretends not to) with key = hidden to key = user_hidden if they suspect users could be impacted.  But like I said, we're slowly adding 'os_' properties anyway, so we might as well get used to it.  I guess another point of advice for operators would be to use property protections to prohibit end users from creating any 'os_'-prefixed proterties, then this situation will never arise as long as Glance development sticks to the os_ convention.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-26 17:55:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm still reviewing.  I ran into a problem at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578755/12/glance/db/simple/api.py@307 ; just want to post it so others can check whether i'm right or not.  Am continuing to review."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-26 18:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: -Code-Review

Looks like the sqlalchemy db api is working fine, we can address my point about the simple api in a follow up patch.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-26 19:00:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

Looks good, let's merge it!"}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-07-26 19:02:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-07-26 19:03:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

Oh definitely +2 on this and the logic problem Brian found will be followed up.'}]

commit_message:
Hide old images

Added new boolean column "os_hidden" in images table. Images where
"os_hidden" = True will be omitted from the image list presented
to the user. This will apply to all image visibilities. However,
the images will continue to be discoverable. User can use
filter "os_hidden=true" in GET v2/images call to see all hidden
images.

Implements: blueprint hidden-images
Change-Id: If8f02ca94fdb8e1ac7a81853cd392988900172d1

[{'created': '2018-04-26 10:23:51.000000000', 'message': "conf: Add '[neutron] physnets' and related options

Things are getting a little bit magic here. We don't want to store
inventory in configuration and we _really_ don't want to do so with
another JSON blob a la the various '[pci]' options. Placement is not yet
at a stage where we avoid the former but we can certainly avoid the
latter. Do so through adding some static opts and some dynamic filter
configuration, similarly to what Cinder does for backend configuration
using its 'enabled_backends' configuration option.

None of this is actually used yet - that will come later.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

commit_message:
conf: Add '[neutron] physnets' and related options

Things are getting a little bit magic here. We don't want to store
inventory in configuration and we _really_ don't want to do so with
another JSON blob a la the various '[pci]' options. Placement is not yet
at a stage where we can avoid the former but we can certainly avoid the
latter. Do so through adding some static opts and some dynamic filter
configuration, similarly to what Cinder does for backend configuration
using its 'enabled_backends' configuration option.

None of this is actually used yet - that will come later.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: Id7c2f0b53c8871ff47a836ec4c324c8cce430b79

commit_message:
Add a new OS::Heat::Delay resource type

This allows users to insert a delay at some point in the workflow while
creating or deleting the stack. Unlike OS::Heat::TestResource, the delay
can be randomised so that when used in parallel across a scaling group it
can be used to work around thundering herd problems.

Change-Id: I49deb9560df9963120445c5900f79a1c5ca09cb5

commit_message:
Keystone: enable service catalog endpoint updates

This PS adds a script to update the keystone catalog endpoints
for keystone itself, as the keystone-bootstrap will not update
these once created.

Change-Id: Ie48c71bbdc9bbd14cebcee46285b3bf51bd28065
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Implement provider drivers - Driver Library

This patch implements the provider driver support library.
This library contains the callback methods that allow provider drivers
to update status and statistics.

This patch also clears some tech debt by correcting the IP addresses
used in some test cases.

Change-Id: I4e91e1b4f7ce611e603ea7aeb17f5c649cdb3c3d
Story: 1655768
Task: 5165

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 20:00:47.000000000', 'message': 'Stop using HostAPI.service_delete

When deleting a service, we already have a cell-targeted
Service object, so we can just call destroy() on the object
directly rather than re-query the service by id from across
all cells, which makes the delete process more efficient.

Change-Id: Ie1aa45a508fbba16e969f216398dee15b37a9569
'}]
commit_message:
Stop using HostAPI.service_delete

When deleting a service, we already have a cell-targeted
Service object, so we can just call destroy() on the object
directly rather than re-query the service by id from across
all cells, which makes the delete process more efficient.

Change-Id: Ie1aa45a508fbba16e969f216398dee15b37a9569

Checking backward compatibility on v1 gates before moving the PENDING_UPDATE status updates into the v1 controller from the flows.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-06-17 23:09:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-06-29 20:16:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Hmm, let me get the straight: Now, the API server updates the DB with the new values and sets the status to Pending_ -- on the worker side we wait for the status to change to PENDING_ and then perform our update. If things go wrong we leave the updated values in the DB? 

That's a significant change but I am also not sure if somebody really lied on a specific order not if we ever guaranteed it. 

Polling the DB is ugly BTW..."}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-07-05 20:00:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13438, 'date': '2018-07-19 10:43:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-07-26 06:37:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-07-26 14:08:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-07-26 22:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Updates the amphora driver for new commit model

The provider driver model changes the way updates are committed
to the database. This patch updates the amphora driver to work with
the new update model for provider drivers. Specificially that the
objects the amphora driver are using will already be updated.

This patch also corrects a bug in the batch member update that would
not update members correctly for provider drivers.

Change-Id: I03ba4d7755bbb0c034c75f29f4a59b1b708daac5

commit_message:
Update centos example in README to use WHEELS

It's important to specify WHEELS when building a distro other than the
default. This was missing from the README example.

Change-Id: Id1ab77b14e6efcc14d6e043d3c2d38883d072809

Without this patch, we are stuck to an old version of bindep
and distro. There is no reason to pin or patch bindep anymore.

This is a problem because more recent distributions like

This should fix it.

Change-Id: Ia3637b3801590cda92be433ca3ba79f62e15512a

commit_message:
Remove bindep pin

Without this patch, we are stuck to an old version of bindep
and distro. There is no reason to pin or patch bindep anymore.

This is a problem because more recent distributions like
opensuse leap 15 will have profile detection issues.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: Ia3637b3801590cda92be433ca3ba79f62e15512a

commit_message:
[FWaaS_v2]: RPC listener should be served by rpc worker

When neutron-api is served by a web server which cannot have a
thread to listen to the RPC [1]. Therefore, neutron-rpc-server will
do that job. So RPC listener should be served by RPC worker instead
of plugin worker.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131722.html

Partially-implements: blueprint run-in-wsgi-server
Change-Id: I2b251cc0bf799f43d3c601e4e4f9f103e2670270

commit_message:
Use ansible_queue_name only for upgrade/update

For upgrade and update nodes with ansible, we do not
need to play with both queue: tripleo and upgrade queue.
If we use both, we can have race where the both can have
different status and we enter in an infinite loop while
reading the socker.

Change-Id: I484a3af4a830af3b97231558876d9a6c0a31e603
Partial-Bug: #1783798
(cherry picked from commit 61dfe32a2a72e5341575ecaa2762f889a2d30e46)
(cherry picked from commit d11bc74b443648c05d4dfb22ffeff285e8926f8e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 15:48:00.000000000', 'message': 'Add flag for returning unofficial types

In consuming code in openstacksdk and keystoneauth, the pattern:

  if stm.is_official(service_type):
      return stm.get_service_type(service_type)
  return service_type

Gets used in several places. Let's provide a way to say that with a
flag:

commit_message:
Add flag for returning unofficial types

In consuming code in openstacksdk and keystoneauth, the pattern:

  if stm.is_official(service_type):
      return stm.get_service_type(service_type)
  return service_type

Gets used in several places. Let's provide a way to say that with a
flag:

  return std.get_service_type(service_type, permissive=True)

which says "get me the official service_type for this, but if it's not
something I know about, give me the thing the user asked for.

Change-Id: Ib8fb14a88ecc690da67967b7e906deb7d923f869

commit_message:
Fix some TripleO projects release model

The os-{apply,collect,net,refresh}-config and paunch projects are used
by other projects (Heat) so they should be cycle-with-intermediary and
not cycle-trailing.

Change-Id: Iadc1995e657d0caee35b337ca50b405baed1eb54

  - microversion 2.63: trusted image certificates

commit_message:
rocky: release python-novaclient 11.0.0

This release adds support for:
  - parsing OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_ID, OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME,
    OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID, and OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME
  - microversion 2.63: trusted image certificates
  - microversion 2.64: new format for policy in server groups
  - microversion 2.65: abort live migrations in queued status

Other changes:
  - the --endpoint-override option has been deprecated and replaced
    with --os-endpoint-override to avoid misinterpreting command line
    arguments
  - the deprecated --bypass-url option has been removed, use
    --os-endpoint-override instead

Change-Id: If00dc97037e05e7c91ddab4f4710dafc9d1299cc

Hey Ana,

Yep, this variable comes from the inventory provided by config-download, currently in an archived bz2 if containerized undercloud is deployed.  The operator has to unpack it and call this to make use of it.

Docs will be following, and I'm also working on a patch to keep this file persisted instead of archived these such use cases.

Thanks for testing.

Can you +2 or are you waiting for Florian?  (I see his previous comment).
David"}, {'account_id': 9317, 'date': '2018-07-26 11:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-22 11:23:08.000000000', 'message': "WIP - add initial role for containerized undercloud validations

This review contains the first working containerized undercloud
validations, specifically targeted to validate by automation or
ad-hoc by operator, the state of a containerized undercloud.

Initially this checks for the presence of running containers
against a provided list, and the same for the ability to connect
to a given list of TCP ports.

TBD - Correct layout and hooks so this can be run automatically
when required.  This is a work in progress and I'd like input
from Florian Fuchs, and any other interested parties.

Change-Id: Idafde4a2e7d7ffa82312308dd8b399485373f593

commit_message:
add initial role for containerized undercloud validations

This review contains the first working containerized undercloud
validations, specifically targeted to validate by automation or
ad-hoc by operator, the state of a containerized undercloud.

Initially this checks for the presence of running containers
against a provided list, and the same for the ability to connect
to a given list of TCP ports.

Change-Id: Idafde4a2e7d7ffa82312308dd8b399485373f593

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2018-07-26 13:27:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-07-26 18:18:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Manually tested and the permissions look good:

 [root@undercloud-0 ironic]# ls -lah /var/lib/ironic
total 4.0K
drwxr-xr-x.  4 42422 42422   38 Jul 26 12:27 .
drwxr-xr-x. 61 root  root  4.0K Jul 26 12:40 ..
drwxr-xr-x.  3 42422 42422  106 Jul 26 14:14 httpboot

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 13:15:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix ironic containers data owning races

Complements I5ad4956174346f0$24945852da09f3841c3378c2b.
Fix ironic_pxe/inspector containers missing the kolla_config sections
to recursively chown /var/lib/ironic* shared paths. That removes data
owning races across other ironic containers starting on earlier or the
same steps/order.

For example, when ironic_pxe_http fails to access the
/var/lib/ironic/httpboot path shared with ironic_conductor, the latter
reports errors like:

DriverLoadError: Driver, hardware type or interface ilo-pxe could not
be loaded. Reason: [Errno 13] Permission denied:
'/var/lib/ironic/httpboot/...

Fixing the dir owner allows HW provisioning to complete w/o such
errors.

Change-Id: I34b54077c1c610a4bed73129e9784b2fa353e944
Closes-bug: #1783762
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ironic containers data owning races

Complements I5ad4956174346f0$24945852da09f3841c3378c2b.
Fix ironic_pxe/inspector containers missing the kolla_config sections
to recursively chown /var/lib/ironic* shared paths. That removes data
owning races across other ironic containers starting on earlier or the
same steps/order.

For example, when ironic_pxe_http fails to access the
/var/lib/ironic/httpboot path shared with ironic_conductor, the latter
reports errors like:

DriverLoadError: Driver, hardware type or interface ilo-pxe could not
be loaded. Reason: [Errno 13] Permission denied:
'/var/lib/ironic/httpboot/...

Fixing the dir owner allows HW provisioning to complete w/o such
errors.

Change-Id: I34b54077c1c610a4bed73129e9784b2fa353e944
Closes-bug: #1783762

commit_message:
Allow passing tags to update/upgrade Ansible workflow

We may use this with external update/upgrade commands to limit the
operation to a particular service (e.g. in envs with both Ceph and
OpenShift, upgrade them one at a time).

Change-Id: I982032a0eadfbfb7f1eadee9cae26c8cd5fcdbba

commit_message:
Upgrades: Refactor httpd_enabled variable

To not to redefine variable multiple times in each service we
split httpd_enabled to per service fact set in step|int == 0 block.

Change-Id: Icea0865aadd9253ead464247bf78f45842b3a578
(cherry picked from commit 81db32ca8c426724efa6bbd43e2ba2b4910072a9)

okay, I changed the file but I'm not so happy with that. I think it's now very easy for spam bots to collect valid email addresses."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-26 06:20:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> okay, I changed the file but I'm not so happy with that. I think
 > it's now very easy for spam bots to collect valid email addresses.

Fair enough.  It isn't any easier to get your email address from [1] than [2] or [3].

My point is that this email address is already very public.

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/election/tree/candidates/stein/I18n?id=e647601c30954757dbf67e620952a064cb1ccbdc
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/governance/tree/reference/projects.yaml#n675
[3] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/projects/i18n.html"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-26 06:31:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Let's tempestconf tool handle swift related conf

* https://review.openstack.org/568869 implements using swift
  healthcheck api to discover swift services and set the
  tempest.conf based on that.

Change-Id: I145a8212af53c3ed98ca04c316a980d8aea8ab29

commit_message:
Further tune the playbooks, configs, and thread pool

* Implements G1 GC optionally. The variable `elastic_g1gc_enabled` has
  been added with a default of false. If this option is set true and the
  system has more than 4GiB of RAM G1GC will be enabled.
* Adds new thread options
* Better constraints coordination nodes
* Interface recover speed has been limited
* Buffer size is now set correctly
* Serialize elk deployment so that upgrades are non-impacting

Change-Id: I89224eeaf4ed29c3bb1d7f8010b69503dbc74e11
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add a networking check for OpenShift on OpenStack

This patch adds a validation to check if there is an external overcloud network
which can be used for an OpenShift on OpenStack deployment.

Change-Id: I0d490067fd79fcd6bdc5dbfcabb2f3fac8dc9daa

commit_message:
minor renaming on monasca webhook driver

driver name: monasca_webhook
column names renamed to clarify the top level metric info
is only the first metric attached to the alarm.

Change-Id: I9746e29db36550572f877c65e05509fe1e3bac86

commit_message:
Adding monasca push driver to receive webhook notifications

Accepts POST webhook notifications [1] at
/v1/data-sources/<data-source-name>/webhook

[1] Expected format:
{'metrics': [{u'id': None,
              u'name': u'load.avg_1_min',
              u'dimensions': {u'hostname': u'openstack-13.local.lan',
                              u'service': u'monitoring'}}],
 'alarm_id': u'2c2fa591-2d49-4568-aa2d-d2882d754e42',
 'state': u'ALARM',
 'alarm_timestamp': 1532333678,
 'tenant_id': u'f0d4ef7886f94108b7e8c85e03e6245b',
 'old_state': u'UNDETERMINED',
 'alarm_description': u'',
 'message': u'Thresholds were exceeded for the sub-alarms: max(load.avg_1_min) > 0.0 with the values: [0.546]',
 'alarm_definition_id': u'1e4c517e-dfa8-4e47-a2a5-2fc795d9f7a9',
 'alarm_name': u'alarmPerHostAj23'}

Partially-Implements: blueprint add-monasca-push-driver
Change-Id: Ib67817c798bb4077e2ba1826e9c9aa85976a64fa

[{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-20 02:46:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-07-20 12:27:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

This could simplify some things and hopefully open it up for other folks to get involved.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-20 14:27:14.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from extnded-maintenance-sig to project-update'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-20 14:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-23 02:02:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-07-23 14:16:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-07-23 15:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-23 22:14:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-07-25 01:36:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-07-25 10:29:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-07-25 19:52:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-07-25 20:06:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-26 16:42:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-26 16:44:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-07-26 20:17:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

A big selling point for me is that the PTL electorate definition for the stable team required a rather cumbersome mechanism for generating voter rolls. It could have been solved by redefining the constituency, but ultimately I think that calling it a SIG provides a much clearer invitation for the people who care about continued maintenance of prior release branches (operators and end users in particular) to get involved there.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-20 02:46:45.000000000', 'message': "Remove Stable branch maintenance as a project team

Deprecate the old project-team for Stable Branch Maintenance and create
a SIG to make it explicit that extended maintenance isn't a developer
only task.  Encourage members of the operator and developer communities
to come together.

Change-Id: I3a67e5883e502c5143675707853788416a1fa7d5
Depends-On: I75abd8a33f3d9ed25318ecd2a318e54b7441b9f9
"}]
commit_message:
Remove Stable branch maintenance as a project team

Deprecate the old project-team for Stable Branch Maintenance and create
a SIG to make it explicit that extended maintenance isn't a developer
only task.  Encourage members of the operator and developer communities
to come together.

Change-Id: I3a67e5883e502c5143675707853788416a1fa7d5
Depends-On: I75abd8a33f3d9ed25318ecd2a318e54b7441b9f9

commit_message:
Add arcsight ingestion into logstash

Logstash is able to handle arcsight events, this PR enables that
capability.

Change-Id: Id220c671cc5d7cb7ee33fb53e2ae4185d579fc2a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Avoid redundant policy syntax checks

Introduce a private variable inside Enforcer class to remember
status of the last policy syntax checks in order to avoid
redundant calls to the check_rules() method.

Having this flag makes the whole rules mechanism faster, as under
certain conditions check_rules() method was being executed
multiple times even when not needed.

Change-Id: Id3992fc0cb567451049a12ebdc6851e737573bb8
Closes-bug: #1723030
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 909a1ea3a7aceb6e0637058b9c6a53d14043d6d1)

Change-Id: I33860ffdcda3e0bc67e488ff2b35bba57241cf02
'}, {'created': '2018-07-22 05:41:11.000000000', 'message': 'Load JSON/YAML string to structure for datasource action execution

Action execution allows using policy to trigger data source client
methods. But some of these methods require a python structure as input,
which cannot be constructed by the congress policy language.

With this patch, the policy language can construct JSON/YAML strings,
which get loaded as python structure before passing to the data source
client methods.

Because there is no automated way to know which arguments to which
methods are non-scalar structures, the functionality requires a
data source driver to specify that information in
self.method_structured_args.

The patch also other related changes:
- specifies the desired structured arguments for the
neutronv2 drivers
- omits the neutron client update_* made redundant by the special
update_resource_attr action.
- updates a policy library to make use of the feature

Change-Id: I33860ffdcda3e0bc67e488ff2b35bba57241cf02

commit_message:
Load JSON/YAML string to structure for datasource action execution

Action execution allows using policy to trigger data source client
methods. But some of these methods require a python structure as input,
which cannot be constructed by the congress policy language.

With this patch, the policy language can construct JSON/YAML strings,
which get loaded as python structure before passing to the data source
client methods.

Because there is no automated way to know which arguments to which
methods are non-scalar structures, the functionality requires a
data source driver to specify that information in
self.method_structured_args.

The patch also other related changes:
- specifies the desired structured arguments for the
neutronv2 drivers
- omits the neutron client update_* made redundant by the special
update_resource_attr action.
- updates a policy library to make use of the feature

Depends-On: I34d1a392d4539ede01666002cfa301c21f9cd4bd

Change-Id: I33860ffdcda3e0bc67e488ff2b35bba57241cf02

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-25 08:32:36.000000000', 'message': "Use a smaller number for checking console log length

Not all images can return console log longer than 10 lines, e.g.,
Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server 7.0 will return console log
with 5 lines.
We don't know how many console log lines should an image return,
but generally speaking it's safer to use a smaller number so that
Tempest can be used for images other than cirros.

Change-Id: I7f6ffe5bdc6b7992fe15935d4f8498e8acf59453
Closes-Bug: #1783509
"}]
commit_message:
Use a smaller number for checking console log length

Not all images can return console log longer than 10 lines, e.g.,
Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server 7.0 will return console log
with 5 lines.
We don't know how many console log lines should an image return,
but generally speaking it's safer to use a smaller number so that
Tempest can be used for images other than cirros.

Change-Id: I7f6ffe5bdc6b7992fe15935d4f8498e8acf59453
Closes-Bug: #1783509

what's the main difference between "yum update" & "yum update-minimal", 
isn't yum update install the security package?

should we use yum update directly?'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-03-23 15:35:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> what's the main difference between "yum update" & "yum
 > update-minimal",
 > isn't yum update install the security package?
 > 
 > should we use yum update directly?

yum install-minimal ensure that we're just installing the package with the security fixes, and not to the latest version of the package that could include other unrelated patches.

From the yum man page:

       update-minimal
              This works like the update command, but if you have the package foo-1 installed and  have
              foo-2  (bugfix) and foo-3 (enhancement) available with updateinfo.xml then update-minimal
              --bugfix will update you to foo-2.

It also gives an example:

       To upgrade packages that have security errata (upgrades to the latest available package) use:

              yum --security update

       To upgrade packages that have security errata (upgrades to the  last  security  errata  package)
       use:

              yum --security update-minimal'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-03-24 01:48:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

then the question is: should we need update all patches to the latest?'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-04-03 15:45:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-04-11 06:08:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-04-12 14:19:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Update base image with latest security fixes

This ensures freshly built kolla images include the latest security
fixes for severity Important and above.

This was suggested by Jon Schlueter and based on the code available at
https://github.com/brianwcook/happywebserver/blob/master/Dockerfile#L27

Change-Id: Ib14f326a335d9519fb888f5486950275985a788c

subject: rocky: release osc-placment 1.3.0
messages: [{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-07-26 18:00:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-07-26 18:01:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-07-26 19:17:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 18:00:13.000000000', 'message': 'rocky: release osc-placment 1.3.0

This release adds support for:
  - allocation candidates
  - new format for allocations dictionary
  - nested resource providers
  - limiting the number allocation candidates
  - requiring traits for allocation candidates

This also changes osc-placement from library => client-library as it
is a plugin for openstackclient. And it removes the stable/rocky
branch that had to be manually deleted because of the
mis-categorization of the library as a non-client. The branch was cut
last week as part of the non-client library freeze and was manually
deleted by the infra team in order for us to do this release.

Change-Id: Ifb97c0aa6f3cabcfbe8d9a2791373c873afca9af
'}]
commit_message:
rocky: release osc-placment 1.3.0

This release adds support for:
  - allocation candidates
  - new format for allocations dictionary
  - nested resource providers
  - limiting the number allocation candidates
  - requiring traits for allocation candidates

This also changes osc-placement from library => client-library as it
is a plugin for openstackclient. And it removes the stable/rocky
branch that had to be manually deleted because of the
mis-categorization of the library as a non-client. The branch was cut
last week as part of the non-client library freeze and was manually
deleted by the infra team in order for us to do this release.

Change-Id: Ifb97c0aa6f3cabcfbe8d9a2791373c873afca9af

commit_message:
Remove httplib

The 'httplib2' package is a legacy Ansible requirement for the
get_url/get_uri module which is no longer needed.

Change-Id: I420dfd74e78963486ed9d5a66b8c3b72372b5ae6

commit_message:
Fix neutron-fullstack-python35 with string config option values

The neutron-fullstack-python35 experimental test job is failing because
the configuration parser is expecting all config option values to be
strings.  Force this to be so.

Change-Id: I74de40fbb47f9dbef6a33d37b952b1b746a48126

commit_message:
Skip quote '=' for token header

If the token is encoded by base64, it may contain '=' char
as well.

We should skip quoting it.

Change-Id: I1ca63d251fa366f0e8e58128d45b729a2489b65c
Partial-Bug: #1783290
(cherry picked from commit eba4bb06d9aeaaf18a7e393ae8c03d47bd052f20)

commit_message:
explicit data types - part II

Additional standard types: UUID, IPNetwork
Expanded enum types
Custom types defined and registered by data source drivers
Type specifications in Nova and Neutron drivers

partially-implements: blueprint explicit-data-types

Change-Id: Idea95374478e8fffee2b2c1a3589f588846c40c3

subject: explicit data types - part I
messages:
[{'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-04 05:29:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-04 05:31:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-04 05:38:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-04 05:39:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-04 05:42:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

hi Pierre,

I wanted to get a rough WIP out so that you can take a look at the interface a policy engine would use to obtain the type information for subscribed tables, and have something to go on with you work on Z3.

Most relevant section:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580038/4/congress/dse2/data_service.py
(all policy engines and data source drivers inherit from this class)'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-04 13:54:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Looks like the failing test is just a mock that does not give back a triple: test_agnostic_dse2.py line 52, adds a None as schema given back. I have had a hard time understanding how the mocked value and actual values are related. I think the intended value was:

node.invoke_service_rpc.return_value = [
            0,
            [['id1', 'name1', 'status1'],
             ['id2', 'name2', 'status2']],
            None
            ]"}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-04 22:48:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-04 22:49:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thank you Pierre. That's exactly what the problem was. The mock return value was already out of date even before this change, but it wasn't exposed because the number of elements just happened to fit."}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-06 08:40:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Looks good. I would add a few things: see comment in datatype and the following.

I would add a types method in compile.Schema that would be the equivalent of columns. It would give back a list of pairs types * boolean as I think nullability is really part of the type (as in kotlin and we could use the same notation if we need type constraints - I think we do). When we do not know the type, we would give back CongressStr, True'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-06 08:43:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-08 23:13:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Thank you Pierre!

Yes that makes sense I can add a types method to compile.Schema.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-11 21:06:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

Types method in compile.Schema added.

One issue is whether to distinguish between type CongressStr and 'no type specified'. In the latter case, the representation could be any JSON scalar (bool, number, str, etc.). For the moment I'm using (None, True) for 'no type specified' rather than (CongressStr, True) because CongressStr would suggest to the data consumer that the representation is of string type and can do things like len(value) (fails for int).

Alternatively, we can change the meaning of CongressStr so that there is no such expectation."}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-11 21:12:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-12 09:34:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

I am not fond of None as the real top of the type hierarchy. I would rather prefer an explicit Top type and be confident that we have a semi lattice. Technically CongressDataType class is already this Top class.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-12 11:30:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

On the other hand, we must have a bottom type for the type-checker that really represents "No type specified yet". This is really different because bot U X = X but Top U X = Top where U is used to merge the current knowledge and new information on the type use.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-12 21:46:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

Thanks Pierre.

We can make a type "Scalar" which serves as the top type, where the value could be any JSON scalar.
String, Int, Bool, etc. would all be subtypes.

I'm not sure I understand the point about 'No type specified yet'. If merging data with no type specified with data of type X, wouldn't the merged data also have no type specified?'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-12 21:46:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-13 07:06:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-13 23:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-17 15:48:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(2 comments)

Except my minor wish on types in compile.py, looks good to me !'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-18 01:46:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-18 01:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

Thanks Pierre!'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-18 05:46:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-18 08:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-18 08:16:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-07-19 05:59:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-20 18:02:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

will remove the zuul changes before merging.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-20 18:06:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

actually i'll remove the temporary zuul changes now so that we won't need to run check jobs again later."}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-20 18:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-21 22:29:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-26 16:13:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
explicit data types - part I

changes:
- Basic data types.
- Compute schema from data type specification in data source drivers.
Limited to hdict translator for now.
- Data type is checked and enforced by data source driver when
ingesting data.
- Policy engine can access type information through compile.Schema
interface.

Future work:
- Data type schema computation from other translator types
- Data type for generated IDs
- Additional standard data types (UUID, etc.)
- Loading of additional data types specified in data source drivers
- Adding type information to data source drivers

partially-implements: blueprint explicit-data-types

Change-Id: I054cae5b9b138ab269c526c9c926fb2838a19314

subject: Switch compute to use different inventory_hostname
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-26 09:26:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-26 17:45:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-26 18:00:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 09:26:04.000000000', 'message': "Switch compute to use different inventory_hostname

Our role tests execute as non-root users, and the roles
need to access the environment variables for that non-root
user. Ansible, when targeting localhost, changes to
'connection: local' and thus breaks everything we need
to do against localhost as root unless we use 'become: true',
but we if generally use that against remote hosts we lose
the environment variables for the non-root user.

As such, we switch the inventory to target 'compute1' instead,
which has the address '10.1.1.1' (br-mgmt), so that we do not
have to deal with the implict connection type changes implemented
by Ansible.

Change-Id: I4f582ec3edd6ccff9573d4fb5e40e6274ea38847
"}]
commit_message:
Switch compute to use different inventory_hostname

Our role tests execute as non-root users, and the roles
need to access the environment variables for that non-root
user. Ansible, when targeting localhost, changes to
'connection: local' and thus breaks everything we need
to do against localhost as root unless we use 'become: true',
but we if generally use that against remote hosts we lose
the environment variables for the non-root user.

As such, we switch the inventory to target 'compute1' instead,
which has the address '10.1.1.1' (br-mgmt), so that we do not
have to deal with the implict connection type changes implemented
by Ansible.

Change-Id: I4f582ec3edd6ccff9573d4fb5e40e6274ea38847

[{'created': '2018-07-25 14:31:54.000000000', 'message': 'Improve nova statedir ownership logic

The nova_compute container kolla config is currently set to recursively change
the ownership of /var/lib/nova to nova:nova on startup.

This is necessary when upgrading from an non-container deployment to a
containerized deployment as the nova uids are not consistent across the host
and container image.

If the nova instancedir is an NFS mount then open filehandles are
broken and every VM using that NFS export fails with I/O errors.

This change re-implements the nova statedir ownership logic to target only the
files/directories controlled by nova.

Requires dist-git change: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/14734

commit_message:
Improve nova statedir ownership logic

The nova_compute container kolla config is currently set to recursively change
the ownership of /var/lib/nova to nova:nova on startup.

This is necessary when upgrading from an non-container deployment to a
containerized deployment as the nova uids are not consistent across the host
and container image.

If the nova instancedir is an NFS mount then open filehandles are
broken and every VM using that NFS export fails with I/O errors.

This change re-implements the nova statedir ownership logic to target only the
files/directories controlled by nova.

Requires dist-git change: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/15018

Change-Id: I57d421feb6356d28002e77fb9bfa50a397758cbf
Closes-bug: 1778465
(cherry picked from commit 58624abf5ff97cb1cb016ceae621ef04ac672145)

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters replace
the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventory and update tests
* Install extra packages for optional drivers

Change-Id: I0b2138ca9eb49387948f2ca87800cf966a9414a8

commit_message:
Prometheus: Rename prometheus endpoint, remove alerts endpoint

This updates the prometheus endpoint entry in the prometheus
chart to reference prometheus by name instead of by function,
bringing it in line with the other osh-infra service endpoints

This also removes the alertmanager endpoint, as it is not required
by the prometheus chart due to identifying alertmanager instances
by built-in prometheus service discovery mechanisms

Change-Id: I5babd2775e26136fc915461fac330f7c8626d45d

commit_message:
WIP: Add more granular prometheus rules for openstack-helm services

This adds the foundation for prometheus rules targeting the services
running as part of OSH. This includes kubernetes services and ceph
and will expand to include basic default rules for all services
that export metrics to prometheus

Change-Id: If8d298abb2603ba082bddea4f96b7211dad665d7

subject: Add metrics label to ceph-mgr service
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 17:05:21.000000000', 'message': 'Dynamically label ceph-mgr service to gather metrics in gate

This dynamically adds the `component=metrics` label to the ceph
mgr service. This label is used in the osh-infra post jobs for
gathering metrics about deployed services that support metrics
exposure for prometheus

Change-Id: Id1fad34c86a2336af9b1cab9ae792bc68d9a84e5
'}, {'created': '2018-02-05 19:04:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add metrics label to ceph-mgr service

This adds the component=metrics label to the ceph-mgr service, as
the service is responsible for exposing the metrics endpoint for
prometheus to scrape

Change-Id: Id1fad34c86a2336af9b1cab9ae792bc68d9a84e5
'}]
commit_message:
Add metrics label to ceph-mgr service

This adds the component=metrics label to the ceph-mgr service, as
the service is responsible for exposing the metrics endpoint for
prometheus to scrape

Change-Id: Id1fad34c86a2336af9b1cab9ae792bc68d9a84e5

commit_message:
DNM - Test using the journald docker log driver

This explores the ability of changing the docker logging daemon to
journald instead of the standard json-fie logging driver

Change-Id: Ia414ce795f95de14557968c7691ee59e3a7f84b1

commit_message:
WIP: Update Elasticsearch services

This updates the Elasticsearch discovery service to a headless
service targeting data nodes, and renames services to be more
descriptive to their function

Change-Id: Iaf4003171c83972847ea074fbeca86293c124f84

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 12:36:44.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ia43a639590d6baa063c9998bcd5f3aab0c901846
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ia43a639590d6baa063c9998bcd5f3aab0c901846

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 20:39:46.000000000', 'message': 'Move volume v2 service client tests to v3 dir

This patchset builds off work done recently in [0] to move the
v2 service clients to v3 dir -- this begins moving the
v2 service client TESTS to v3 dir.

This is done for the following reasons:

* v2 is deprecated and subsequently really just calls the
  v3 clients referentially [1]
* unnecessary deprecation warnings are emitted for unit
  tests [2]
* it is much harder to figure out what coverage is missing:
  you need to look at v2 and v3 dir together to figure it
  out
* poor code organization: it is much cleaner to consolidate
  the tests together

This patchset only does this for volumes v2 client -- if
there is agreement we can proceed with the other client
tests next.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536121/
[1] e.g. https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/2b6e955c59d814538ceeb58d9160433eb915688d/tempest/lib/services/volume/v2/volumes_client.py#L17
[2] e.g. http://logs.openstack.org/65/578765/2/check/openstack-tox-py35/88f9858/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-06-28_13_43_16_409494

commit_message:
Move volume v2 service client unit tests to v3 dir

This patchset builds off work done recently in [0] to move the
v2 service clients to v3 dir -- this begins moving the
v2 service client unit tests to v3 dir.

This is done for the following reasons:

* v2 is deprecated and subsequently really just calls the
  v3 clients referentially [1]
* unnecessary deprecation warnings are emitted for unit
  tests [2], they should be cleaned up
* it is much harder to figure out what coverage is missing:
  you need to look at v2 and v3 dir together to figure it
  out
* poor code organization: it is much cleaner to consolidate
  the tests together

This patchset only does this for volumes v2 client -- if
there is agreement we can proceed with the other client
tests next.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536121/
[1] e.g. https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/2b6e955c59d814538ceeb58d9160433eb915688d/tempest/lib/services/volume/v2/volumes_client.py#L17
[2] e.g. http://logs.openstack.org/65/578765/2/check/openstack-tox-py35/88f9858/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-06-28_13_43_16_409494

subject: Avoid redundant policy syntax checks
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8770, 'name': 'Ken Giusti', 'email': 'kgiusti@gmail.com', 'username': 'kgiusti'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 10267, 'name': 'venkata anil', 'email': 'anilvenkata@redhat.com', 'username': 'anil'}, {'_account_id': 21798, 'name': 'Bernard Cafarelli', 'email': 'bcafarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcafarel'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 14:09:29.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid redundant policy syntax checks

Introduce a private variable inside Enforcer class to remember
status of the last policy syntax checks in order to avoid
redundant calls to the check_rules() method.

Having this flag makes the whole rules mechanism faster, as under
certain conditions check_rules() method was being executed
multiple times even when not needed.

Change-Id: Id3992fc0cb567451049a12ebdc6851e737573bb8
Closes-bug: #1723030
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 909a1ea3a7aceb6e0637058b9c6a53d14043d6d1)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid redundant policy syntax checks

Introduce a private variable inside Enforcer class to remember
status of the last policy syntax checks in order to avoid
redundant calls to the check_rules() method.

Having this flag makes the whole rules mechanism faster, as under
certain conditions check_rules() method was being executed
multiple times even when not needed.

Change-Id: Id3992fc0cb567451049a12ebdc6851e737573bb8
Closes-bug: #1723030
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 909a1ea3a7aceb6e0637058b9c6a53d14043d6d1)

commit_message:
Adds support for z3 policies

z3 is a new kind of theory where rules are treated by Microsoft Z3 engine.
The end-user must explicitly mark policies using this engine.

Change-Id: I519821ccb8a14d9a28bf890bb98c55c01c2a0e9c
Partially-implements: blueprint alternative-engine-z3

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I7ffea1a85841bd993cc9458e7d2fac460e5024b2

commit_message:
Enable mutable config in mistral

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
oslo.service provides an option here Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e
allows services to tell oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be
called by passing a parameter.

This commit is to use the same. This allows mistral to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. we should be able to turn debug
logging on and off by changing the config.

tc goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/enable-mutable-configuration.html

Change-Id: I8ea7085b9343b07f5fe419d30a68c00caec1b745

subject: Remove Monasca statsd client Docker files
messages: [{'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-07-26 10:26:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-07-26 11:12:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-07-26 15:25:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 10:26:12.000000000', 'message': 'Remove Monasca statsd client Docker files

The monasca-statsd repo is a statsd client library with Monasca
extensions such as support for adding dimensions to metrics. It is
designed to be included in application code for sending application
specific metrics to the Monasca statsd service, which is part of the
Monasca Agent.

This commit removes the Monasca Statsd Docker image because the normal
use case would be to include it as a library in an application. The
monasca-statsd tarball is left so that it can be added to containers
using the additions mechanism if a user wants to generate application
specific metrics.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-containers
Change-Id: I20ec284e8f51eb046cc6de2636680847097a3ac1
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Monasca statsd client Docker files

The monasca-statsd repo is a statsd client library with Monasca
extensions such as support for adding dimensions to metrics. It is
designed to be included in application code for sending application
specific metrics to the Monasca statsd service, which is part of the
Monasca Agent.

This commit removes the Monasca Statsd Docker image because the normal
use case would be to include it as a library in an application. The
monasca-statsd tarball is left so that it can be added to containers
using the additions mechanism if a user wants to generate application
specific metrics.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-containers
Change-Id: I20ec284e8f51eb046cc6de2636680847097a3ac1

commit_message:
Strict two level limit model

This patch introduced the hierarchical limit structure
into Keystone.

The strict two level enforcement model is added as well.

Change-Id: Ic80e435a14ad7d6d4eccd4cd6365fb2d99fd26c1
bp: strict-two-level-model

Add '_' as a valid character in error.codes, because that's what's
present in the wild.

The schema is updated to include a pattern check, and one of the

Change-Id: I6bcfd5d411b2b9c540546f92859647333114a8f8

commit_message:
Expand schema for error.codes to reflect reality

Add '_' as a valid character in error.codes, because that's what's
present in the wild.

The schema is updated to include a pattern check, and one of the
examples is changed to demonstrate the use of the new char.

Change-Id: I6bcfd5d411b2b9c540546f92859647333114a8f8

messages:
[{'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-06-27 12:33:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-27 17:10:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Let's actually elaborate on the idea of a place to host errors.

Given that we're moving from centralized docs, api-ref, devstack and tempest plugins, etc, it may not be a great idea to introduce a new centralized place. I suggest we take the same approach as api-ref: build errors from project's repository. So e.g. we have https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/baremetal/, and we can have https://developer.openstack.org/errors/baremetal/.

Or maybe even make it a part of api-ref? It actually makes some sense: it's a part of the API, after all. And if we decide to publish schemas, we should do something similar."}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-06-28 20:17:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

what dtantsur said'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-07-01 17:37:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-07-01 17:41:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add links to errors-example.json

They've been TODO for a long time. The provided links are
examples only, but include advice that services should publish
their own error code documentation.

commit_message:
Keystone: Use service domain for service users

This PS moves to use a service domain for openstack service accounts
and users.

Change-Id: Ibe7c5f83a9fc9960fb85e53f9745d24f2192a94a
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Adds Support for MNAIO CentOS 7 Environment

* Adds support for provisioning a Multi Node AIO using
  CentOS 7.
* Cleans up older MNAIO/Compute/Infra image configs
* Increases LB/Logging/Swift VM ram to allow for CentOS rootfs
  to load into RAM. (1GB to 2GB)
* Uses systemd-network networking for configuring network/bridges
* Adds keymap to kvm configuration to alleviate keyboard issues in
  virt-manager
Change-Id: I54d903e7c1c70882e8b20a9cef4eafb42be46770

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 15:18:59.000000000', 'message': 'Gather facts in all overcloud hosts when --limit is set.

When running the deplo_steps_playbook.yaml playbook
with the --limit option, as it is the case in major
upgrades, the ansible facts gathering will be run only
for the host matching the role/host passed in the
--limit argument. This causes errors in other tasks which
access to other hosts ansible facts.

This patch uses the delegate_to feature to ensure that
the ansible facts gathering is run for all expected
hosts.

Change-Id: I79d752cc35dc5bddb13f87f2ceaae687717d6cf7
Closes-Bug: #1782168
'}, {'created': '2018-07-18 07:22:32.000000000', 'message': 'Gather facts in all overcloud hosts when --limit is set.

commit_message:
Gather facts in all overcloud hosts when --limit is set.

When running the deplo_steps_playbook.yaml playbook
with the --limit option, as it is the case in major
upgrades, the ansible facts gathering will be run only
for the host matching the role/host passed in the
--limit argument. This causes errors in other tasks which
access to other hosts ansible facts.

This patch uses the delegate_to feature to ensure that
the ansible facts gathering is run for all expected
hosts.

Change-Id: I79d752cc35dc5bddb13f87f2ceaae687717d6cf7
Closes-Bug: #1782168
