This change moves docker and docker-distribution installation from

commit_message:
Do undercloud container prepare in external_deploy_tasks

This change moves docker and docker-distribution installation from
step 1 to host_prep_tasks, then runs container prepare as
external_deploy_tasks.

Container image prepare needs to run before any steps which require
container images, and it always needs to run on the undercloud because
it only ever populates the undercloud registry. Docker needs to be
installed in host_prep_tasks, since it is just before
external_deploy_tasks step 1.

The aim is to move these prepare tasks into their own service file so
they can be run during undercloud install and overcloud deploy, as an
alternative to having a dedicated mistral action for the overcloud
prepare.

Change-Id: I2c82b6829e574424067130d1a369ff30030fb4bc
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

commit_message:
Allow to specify the image type to upload

When trying to just replace a single image in the overcloud,
the client is asking for all the images to be present in
the working directory. Allowing to pass an image-type flag
(with os/ipa values), that will restrict the upload to that type.

Change-Id: I4e48458f83d2a646aad873b0577dc3bea766d2d7
Fixes-Bug: #1778500

commit_message:
Rework roles file getters to shared utility

Staticmethods cause data races for tox concurrent
execution of test cases.

Shared utility just works good as well.

Change-Id: I684f55c9e54f76bac1ce330175206c77675dcd68
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 8532, 'date': '2018-07-12 14:59:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-07-12 15:41:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Pasting my comment from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/581060/ to continue the discussion:

I agree, that there should be an explicit way to specify order of environments, although should that be a default? How about doing it other way around and provide an option to disable automatic ordering?

If I look correctly the tripleoclient does not use UpdateCapabilities action to set environments in plan-environment.yaml, so backporting this change as is should not break anything.

Potential problem with UpdateCapabilities action is that it takes an object such as 
{
environments/containers-default-parameters.yaml: true
environments/network-isolation-v6.yaml: false
environments/network-isolation.yaml: true
overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml: true
}
so it does not specify the order. That would need to be updated too. We can do all these changes once CLI switches to using UpdateCapabilities action.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-07-12 15:52:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8532, 'date': '2018-07-12 16:00:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8532, 'date': '2018-07-12 16:00:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-07-16 10:51:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-07-16 11:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Can we please finish the discussion here [1] before merging this one?

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/581060/'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-07-16 11:03:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This change reintroduces https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1541721 as it adds requirement to update TripleO UI.'}, {'account_id': 8532, 'date': '2018-07-16 14:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think the language about "reintroduces" is a bit harsh.  It would require you to add a boolean argument to the workflow input.  In any case, I'm +0 on the competing cases of the web UI vs the CLI here.  I think there needs to be a discussion and agreement on feature parity.  I thought that was discussed previously in Atlanta and Denver PTGs.  Maybe we can address the UI squad upstream to see if this is something they care about or want to drive.'}, {'account_id': 11085, 'date': '2018-07-18 15:12:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7065, 'date': '2018-07-18 15:30:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Makes sorting environments with capabilities-map optional

This patch adds an argument to the UpdateCapabilitesAction to
optionally enable the sorting of environments utilizing the
capabilites-map file in the plan.  This patch also restores
the unit tests before the introduction of the additional
sorting and adds a new test for the optional sorting.

Change-Id: I6944ba7f673344f0d40c0bdf8cfba78e2d758da5

Release repository testing is erroring that we lack
an author and author-email fields.

So lets add the fields!

commit_message:
Fix for failure in cleaning

The cleaning operation may fail, if an in-band clean step were to
execute after the completion of out-of-band clean step that
performs reboot of the node. The failure is caused because of race
condition where in cleaning is resumed before the Ironic Python
Agent(IPA) is ready to execute clean steps.

Story: #2002731
Task: #22580
Change-Id: Idaacb9fbb1ea3ac82cdb6769df05d8206660c8cb

subject: Add DIB element to blacklist nouveau
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 8745, 'name': 'Lars Kellogg-Stedman', 'email': 'lars@redhat.com', 'username': 'lars'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 21741, 'name': 'Andreas Florath', 'email': 'andreas@florath.net', 'username': 'florath'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}, {'_account_id': 26431, 'name': 'daixianmeng', 'email': 'daixianmeng@yovole.com', 'username': 'daixianmeng'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-06-01 16:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-06-01 16:47:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-09 12:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-06-14 20:53:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-06-20 11:26:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

We have an element to blacklist modules, called modprobe-blacklist. You can just send the list of items to blacklist by using  DIB_MODPROBE_BLACKLIST setting. Why don't use that?"}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-06-20 11:59:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Looked at modprobe-blacklist initially, but it doesn't support setting options (could add this though, but I also figured it would be better to have a distinct element for this.

NB this isn't the only module that blacklists, e.g elements/hpdsa/post-install.d/95-hpdsa"}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-06-20 21:16:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Also want the ability to depend on this element in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573223/2/diskimage_builder/elements/nvidia-gpu/element-deps'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-06-21 05:50:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Ok removing the -1 because i can see the reasoning for it. However i think that will be more correct, if we modify the blacklist module, to allow to pass extra options as you do now.
Asking the opinion of Ian as well, before deciding...'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-21 06:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I really don't like carrying this around in dib forever more, when we already have modprobe-blacklist

This seems like almost exactly the same problem we had with sysctl setting.

I think what I would like to see is an enhancement to modprobe-blacklist to pick up files from elements and put them in /etc/modprobe.d, just like proposed in [1].  It seems that way, an nvidia gpu element can just "element-deps" on modeprobe-blacklist, drop a modprobe.d file in the element and it gets picked up an installed.  you can put whatever you want in it, options or modules etc.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/407739/4/elements/sysctl/extra-data.d/10-sysctl-copy'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-21 06:27:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

note that review i linked to is old.  we have a function for looking in the elements now

something like

 eval declare -A image_elements=($(get_image_element_array))

 for i in "${!image_elements[@]}"; do
    element=$i
    element_dir=${image_elements[$i]}

    # look in element_dir for the file/directory, copy it into place
 done

should work'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-06-22 14:03:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

So, i created a new modprobe element on this change: https://review.openstack.org/577170

This is going to have the same functionality as modprobe-blacklist, but is also going to include a more generic functionality, that will copy all the contents that are on the modprobe.d directory of your element, to the /etc/modprobe.d directory on your image.
So if you can depend on that element, the only thing that you need to do is to include that file in the specified directory.'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2018-06-23 17:01:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I agree here with Yolanda: a more generic approach would be better.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-06-23 23:52:19.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+1 by Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-06-26 22:00:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-06-26 22:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from 577170 to bp/tripleo-vgpu'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-06-27 08:39:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-28 05:42:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

AIUI, there are reasons to use this outside of just installing the NVIDIA gpu drivers (which would imply just put it in that element).  Based on that I'm ok with this"}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-07-25 10:59:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> AIUI, there are reasons to use this outside of just installing the NVIDIA gpu drivers (which would imply just put it in that element).  Based on that I'm ok with this

Is this waiting a respond before approving? I read that as a statement, not a question....

To clarify, yes, this is required for reliable PCI passthrough of a GPU to a guest and for virtual GPU support."}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-07-25 15:36:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-07-26 05:50:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add DIB element to blacklist nouveau

This ensures nouveau is not loaded at boot, which is required when installing
NVIDIA GPU drivers and to avoid issues with PCI passthrough of NVIDIA GPUs.

The option to disable kernel modesets ensures that it can be unloaded again if
it happens to be loaded after boot (e.g manually or implicitly by X).

bp tripleo-vgpu

Change-Id: I60815de86e7b22dfb39555af9d2d53564841e2ab
Related-bug: 1774674

commit_message:
modprobe DIB_MODPROBE_BLACKLIST should be optional

modprobe element currently fails when DIB_MODPROBE_BLACKLIST is not set.
As there are now two methods to control blacklisting this should be optional.

Change-Id: Ibf3c31a95177ba88c1b93228490c7f36f5b70b57

[{'created': '2018-07-12 15:27:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes ordering of environment files in a deployment plan

Sometimes making changes in basic deployment breaks the order of
passed env files and leads to a failed deployment.  This patch
orders the environment files according to the rules defined in
the capabilities-map.yaml file.

Change-Id: Idbb6f0f3adebebd429bcb3447e559838180f4b1c
(cherry picked from commit bae429650289cdfd96a52d826ad775c526dfdb1b)

commit_message:
Fixes ordering of environment files in a deployment plan

Sometimes making changes in basic deployment breaks the order of
passed env files and leads to a failed deployment.  This patch
orders the environment files according to the rules defined in
the capabilities-map.yaml file.

Change-Id: Idbb6f0f3adebebd429bcb3447e559838180f4b1c
(cherry picked from commit bae429650289cdfd96a52d826ad775c526dfdb1b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-25 22:15:32.000000000', 'message': 'Skip udev rule install in containers

Ensure that udev rules are not installed and reloaded
when running in a container; this is not permitted and
the udev rules are used for block devices, which are
not supported within container based deployments.

Change-Id: I9a580172fcbbf8cec63af7adccb0808915184658
Closes-Bug: 1776713
(cherry picked from commit dd426903471f28eff8e357bac2ca0889ffcff4b9)
'}]
commit_message:
Skip udev rule install in containers

Ensure that udev rules are not installed and reloaded
when running in a container; this is not permitted and
the udev rules are used for block devices, which are
not supported within container based deployments.

Change-Id: I9a580172fcbbf8cec63af7adccb0808915184658
Closes-Bug: 1776713
(cherry picked from commit dd426903471f28eff8e357bac2ca0889ffcff4b9)

commit_message:
Mirror self-link trust check from tempest

To ensure the self-link for trusts is sane, mirror the check tempest
does. This change closes a gap on a possibly changing self-link
that would only be caught in tempest making for easier local testing.

Change-Id: I1ede6dcafdeb75b94732efe0d4c80ccfef2a40f0
Partial-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
Sync CDM among Decision Engines by using notification pool

This commit allows to consume notifications via notifications pools[1].
Listeners in notification pools recieves a copy of notification. It
will let Watcher to sync Data Models of Decision Engines.

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.messaging/ocata/notification_listener.html

Change-Id: Ie37528263181924f84510500fc1277b0237c1df8
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-watcher-ha-active-active-mode

commit_message:
Take periodic and dryrun out of TOCI_JOBTYPE

Handle periodic and dryrun cases. TOCI_JOBTYPE logic is gone from
toci_gate_test.sh script, but it is still being used in some other
places of the code. These should be addressed in follow-up patches
with the complete removal of toci_jobtype from the code.

Change-Id: I449d291191cd4e4c95db1e992c592a681db51fbe

commit_message:
Neutron-LBaaS to Octavia migration tool

This patch adds a tool that migrates running load balancers from Neutron-LBaaS
to Octavia.
It also creates a periodic test to run the migration tool.

Story: 1640526
Task: 5161
Task: 22605

Change-Id: I541f84fffe26af8ff49f8cb05733ef4018a89dbd

commit_message:
Check baremetal flavors for custom resource class

Since queens it has become mandatory for baremetal flavors to have a
custom resource class defined for scheduling by the baremetal service.
When flavors do not have custom resource classes, we run into scheduling
bugs like https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1560690. This
commit ensures that all baremetal flavors are associated with some
custom resource class.

Change-Id: I2d34c41a2bb2a6cce74bbe70faf7371eb9016b72

commit_message:
Don't run host_prep_tasks from {{role}}HostPrepDeployment

host_prep_tasks are run from deploy_steps_playbook.yaml, so there's no
need to also run them as part of the {{role}}HostPrepDeployment
resources.

Change-Id: If1bf6dda19e6e0b875463c421f9504efab85251b

commit_message:
Collect /tmp/ansible-mistral-action into CI job logs.

When executing the ansible-playbook mistral
action a directory is created within undercloud's
/tmp/. This directory contains the ansible
configuration files used to run the playbook, as well
as an script which contains the ansible-playbook
command run. All this information can be very
useful for CI job debugging purposes now that
we're moving into an ansible-centric TripleO
operations.

Change-Id: I1ae2d712ce08b705913bc22587984105ce497e64

commit_message:
Lower the required version of ipaddress

CentOS 7 distributes 1.0.16, and there is no real reason to avoid it.
Plus, in our probetests we apparently cannot avoid the system package.

Change-Id: I108ec2438dbc02f3e85f8da43e11ff4cdcfd1e4b

commit_message:
Replace os-client-config to openstacksdk

Since now os-client-config has been superceded by openstacksdk[1].
So need to replace the os-client-config in zaqarclient to
slove the issue that 'No module named os_client_config'.

[1]:https://docs.openstack.org/os-client-config/latest/

Change-Id: I19bee5f276dcdd9a885fd99b6b656647e28ba139
(cherry picked from commit 792a6d0ff1587ef103a2f3be92bc6e283fa5d965)

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I47130ea63d4427074bf51957032c89c55f7a8dcf

commit_message:
Drop mox, no longer needed

The porting of mistral-dashboard is complete.
This fullfills the community goal "Remove Use of mox/mox3 for Testing"
set for Rocky: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/mox_removal.html

Remove use_mox and remove dead code.

Change-Id: I59839fecd85caaf8b81129b7f890c4ed50d39db8
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

yes, subnode are nodes != controller, devstack-multinode jobs are not working properly, other projects uses legacy-dsvm-devstack-multinode which works fine.

It seems the new jobs cannot manage non core services in multienv, so barbican, mistral, etc are trying to install control plane on compute nodes.

We need to try and error to find which service to disable'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-07-03 09:41:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Published edit on patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-07-03 11:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Published edit on patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-07-03 11:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Published edit on patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-07-03 19:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Published edit on patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-07-04 07:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Published edit on patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-07-04 07:49:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

As per logs on compute node, it's not able to connect to mysql database (connection refused) which is running on controller node.

Do we need to allow mysql port in iptables on controller node?
I don't know how to add rules to iptables using devstack."}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-07-04 07:50:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

19.42.19 should  be 14.42.19'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-07-20 02:52:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 34.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-07-20 07:01:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 35.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-07-20 09:01:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 35:

Now at least tacker functional tests are running and some of them are passing as well.

But instances booted on the other compute node are failing to boot due to below error:
 Instance failed network setup after 1 attempt(s): PortBindingFailed: Binding failed for port e23fb280-ff15-4b72-a911-b8038d67da61, please check neutron logs for more information

Error Log: http://paste.openstack.org/show/726326/'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-07-23 04:40:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 36.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-07-23 08:19:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 36:

ml2_conf.ini files on both controller and compute node should be almost same except local_ip address, but that wasn't the case in PS 35. This was one of the reason why PortBindingFailed error is occuring on the compute node. This issue has been fixed in PS 36 but now functional tests is complaining /etc/tacker/tacker,conf not found error. But in fact, tacker.conf is present.

tacker.conf
 http://logs.openstack.org/70/578170/36/check/tacker-functional-devstack-multinode/f9876bd/controller/logs/etc/tacker/tacker_conf.txt.gz.

Controller
 http://logs.openstack.org/70/578170/35/check/tacker-functional-devstack-multinode/2619d3f/controller/logs/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini.gz

Compute
 http://logs.openstack.org/70/578170/35/check/tacker-functional-devstack-multinode/2619d3f/compute1/logs/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini.gz"}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-07-23 08:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 36:

is because tests is are being executed in compute host instead of controller, compute doesnt have a tacker service running on it 
http://logs.openstack.org/70/578170/36/check/tacker-functional-devstack-multinode/f9876bd/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-23_05_20_27_665939'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-07-23 08:30:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 36:

maybe a controller group here works, https://github.com/openstack/tacker/blob/master/playbooks/devstack/run.yaml#L1

Not sure if single node have inventory group controller and will break single node tests'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-07-23 08:31:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 37.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-07-23 10:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 38.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-07-24 02:00:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 39.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-07-24 03:19:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 39:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-07-25 14:42:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 46.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-07-26 03:14:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 46: Code-Review-1

http://logs.openstack.org/70/578170/46/check/tacker-functional-devstack-multinode/0b5ddfc/controller/confs/devstack/

it seems our two nodes env is using just one of it to launch vm.

also the br-mgmt is not connected among two nodes.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-07-26 03:48:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 47.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-07-26 04:34:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 47:

>> it seems our two nodes env is using just one of it to launch vm.

As I said earlier, I had verified instances were spawned successfully on both the compute nodes.

one running on controller node [1]  and another on the compute1 node [2].

I have seen log messages in compute service log. Search with message "Instance spawned successfully".

commit_message:
Add multinode jobs

Add devstack multinode job.

This job installs nova in a single cell as "late anti-affinity
[1] doesn't work in multi-cells environment.

[1] : https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/cellsv2-layout.html#operations-requiring-upcalls

Co-Author: tpatil <tushar.vitthal.patil@gmail.com>
Co-Author: yong sheng gong <gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net>

Change-Id: I56a9cf4bb553c8026eec73212a3742d5eab17420

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-25 15:51:26.000000000', 'message': "Reduce duplication in federated auth APIs

The GET /v3/OS-FEDERATION/projects and GET /v3/OS-FEDERATION/domains
APIs were introduced to handle tokens from federated users, but now
that GET /v3/auth/projects and GET /v3/auth/domains know how to handle
federated tokens, they're just duplicate APIs.

In the past we deprecated these federated auth APIs, but they still
used separate code paths from GET /v3/auth/projects and GET
/v3/auth/domains. The two code paths are true duplication in that they
don't expect to differ over time and should provide the same user
experience.

Instead of running the risk that comes with two code paths that do the
same thing, we should consolidate them.

Conflicts:
  keystone/federation/controllers.py due to the fact that pre-Queens
  code used a different dependency framework. This was reworked in
  the Queens release, causing a conflict with this patch since it
  touches the same code.
  keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py due to a couple test with
  similar naming and placement within the same test module.

Co-Authored-By: Kristi Nikolla <kristi@nikolla.me>

Closes-Bug: 1779205
Change-Id: Ib906c42e1dd2c2408ccd2e256ffd876af02af3fe
(cherry picked from commit df5d75571ed274b2964ed52048768c6d9f24d138)

commit_message:
Reduce duplication in federated auth APIs

The GET /v3/OS-FEDERATION/projects and GET /v3/OS-FEDERATION/domains
APIs were introduced to handle tokens from federated users, but now
that GET /v3/auth/projects and GET /v3/auth/domains know how to handle
federated tokens, they're just duplicate APIs.

In the past we deprecated these federated auth APIs, but they still
used separate code paths from GET /v3/auth/projects and GET
/v3/auth/domains. The two code paths are true duplication in that they
don't expect to differ over time and should provide the same user
experience.

Instead of running the risk that comes with two code paths that do the
same thing, we should consolidate them.

Conflicts:
  keystone/federation/controllers.py due to the fact that pre-Queens
  code used a different dependency framework. This was reworked in
  the Queens release, causing a conflict with this patch since it
  touches the same code.
  keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py due to a couple test with
  similar naming and placement within the same test module.

Co-Authored-By: Kristi Nikolla <kristi@nikolla.me>

Closes-Bug: 1779205
Change-Id: Ib906c42e1dd2c2408ccd2e256ffd876af02af3fe
(cherry picked from commit df5d75571ed274b2964ed52048768c6d9f24d138)

commit_message:
Runtime: less strict for resource limiting

When resource limiting fails, just log a message instead of failing the
execution.

Change-Id: I1942620ecbe35508032e11dafc4784f6ff2300e1
Story: 2003053
Task: 23090

commit_message:
[QoS] Clear rate limits when default null values are used

In that case before, tc was called with zero rate and burst values.
Newer iproute versions (>= 4.9) do not allow that anymore, so we send a
clear command instead

This also fixes QoS L3 agent extension functional tests run with such an
iproute version (CentOS 7.5, Ubuntu 18.04)

Change-Id: Idf16e2460bd434f5eab79745558c55c6579e81e8
Closes-Bug: #1782141
(cherry picked from commit 7e0c1e9e23788fc60b2bf19659a7b513ba330dea)

[{'created': '2018-06-01 19:41:52.000000000', 'message': "Remove redundant cleanups in test_volume_backup

The BaseVolumeTest class contains some helper methods that do their
own cleanup steps within them. However, several of the tests in
VolumesBackupsTest were also doing identical cleanup.

Occasionally, this results in a failure to cleanup in the gate [1]
because a test that doesn't wait for resource deletion [2] after it
cleans up a resource can leave a resource in a mid-deletion state that
the base class cleanup will fail with a 400 when *it* tries to delete
the same resource.

This was noticed on the Ocata branch but it looks like the same issues
exist on master in the plugin, so I'm starting with the fix here.

Closes-Bug: #1774684

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/53/570653/1/check/legacy-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph/c5d03e7/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-05-30_04_41_10_689262

	cinder/tests/tempest/api/volume/test_volume_backup.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict is from the fact that the idempotent_id
decorator is in the test base class in Ocata instead of in a separate
'decorators' imported module.

commit_message:
Remove redundant cleanups in test_volume_backup

The BaseVolumeTest class contains some helper methods that do their
own cleanup steps within them. However, several of the tests in
VolumesBackupsTest were also doing identical cleanup.

Occasionally, this results in a failure to cleanup in the gate [1]
because a test that doesn't wait for resource deletion [2] after it
cleans up a resource can leave a resource in a mid-deletion state that
the base class cleanup will fail with a 400 when *it* tries to delete
the same resource.

This was noticed on the Ocata branch but it looks like the same issues
exist on master in the plugin, so I'm starting with the fix here.

Closes-Bug: #1774684

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/53/570653/1/check/legacy-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph/c5d03e7/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-05-30_04_41_10_689262
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin/blob/28456a1/cinder_tempest_plugin/api/volume/test_volume_backup.py#L64

 Conflicts:
    cinder/tests/tempest/api/volume/test_volume_backup.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict is from the fact that the idempotent_id
decorator is in the test base class in Ocata instead of in a separate
'decorators' imported module.

Change-Id: I2a29daf56f8327fce405e7969767dc9993849f19
(cherry picked from commit b12c8a34bc07ac8451e8493992a2227c7c803f0e)

commit_message:
Add serialization for TokenModel object

Future changes are going to rely on an instance of TokenModel through
out the token provider API instead of a dictionary. We need to
serialize the new object so that we can cache it like we do with
dictionaries.

This change addes a handler that serializes instances of TokenModel
before putting them into the cache backend and reinflates them back
into TokenModel objects on the way out.

Partial-Bug: 1778945
Change-Id: I3d8def90b035616a21edfc0ed42f43fcbd76fe23

commit_message:
Do not pass disk_over_commit after Microversion 2.25

disk_over_commit is removed from os-migrateLive in Microversion 2.25,
so do not pass it when calling live_migrate_server.

Ref: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#maximum-in-mitaka

Implements blueprint: clear-deprecated-api

Change-Id: Ie2c47908bfd2dd9753865f4f6ee58b991f538de8

[{'created': '2018-06-06 20:08:40.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I98cf0911acb2f24e5d48661e20ff4a068b678754
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Support to specify workload type for runtime

Support to specify ``trusted`` for runtime creation. In Kubernetes
orchestrator implementation, it's using
``io.kubernetes.cri-o.TrustedSandbox`` annotation in the pod specification
to choose the underlying container runtime. This feature is useful to
leverage the security container technology such as Kata containers or
gVisor. It also gets rid of the security concerns for running image type
function.

Story: 2003088
Task: 23172
Change-Id: Ic4fa3e97dcc239c7177448e3cef5d0f02340d302

commit_message:
Enable mutable config in sahara

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
oslo.service provides an option here Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e
allows services to tell oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be
called by passing a parameter.

This commit is to use the same. This allows sahara to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. we should be able to turn debug
logging on and off by changing the config.

tc goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/enable-mutable-configuration.html

Change-Id: I11d31a80afb326fa3416726c6f68b4930346264a

commit_message:
KubeADM: enable shared pid ns

This PS enables the pod shared pid feature gate in k8s, which allows
the puase container to reap processes when desired.

Change-Id: I01eac64bfa029027465d47c5036119cf5799a100
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

messages:
[{'account_id': 24319, 'date': '2018-07-24 19:50:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-07-24 19:50:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-07-25 06:52:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-07-26 03:49:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 19:50:47.000000000', 'message': 'Update swift for replication issues

There are corresponding image changes to go with these ansible
changes - changes in rsyncd template, and add
environment settings for RSYNC_CONNECT_PROG (i.e. nc)

nc allows for rsync replication to easily target {{ swift_rsync_port }}

update the lock file and chroot settings in template - see bug
for more details.

Change-Id: Ic81b7de8fad8aec9416e4e27e8ffda6d03be293c
Closes-Bug: #1733851
(cherry picked from commit 3245201af1d5a2895f1baa1be90171f44823fbd1)
'}]
commit_message:
Update swift for replication issues

There are corresponding image changes to go with these ansible
changes - changes in rsyncd template, and add
environment settings for RSYNC_CONNECT_PROG (i.e. nc)

nc allows for rsync replication to easily target {{ swift_rsync_port }}

update the lock file and chroot settings in template - see bug
for more details.

Change-Id: Ic81b7de8fad8aec9416e4e27e8ffda6d03be293c
Closes-Bug: #1733851
(cherry picked from commit 3245201af1d5a2895f1baa1be90171f44823fbd1)

commit_message:
Add bandit for security static analysis

This change adds a basic bandit config for Cinder. It can be invoked
by running the tox environment for bandit;
    tox -e bandit

Change-Id: I0aa5a9ef82d93401bd4459ec761366f3f98cc20b

commit_message:
Move hugetlbfs gid config to BootParams service

Group hugetlbfs's gid has to be updated to match with kolla config.
Earlier gid change is applied and then the node is rebooted for
kernel args. But after ansible based reboot, the reboot is moved
before the PreNetworkConfig, which requires ovs restart after gid
update. Instead of ovs restart, moving gid update to BootParams
service, makes it single place to apply and reboot.

Change-Id: Id8c26b88ff92104984a27877fbcc009475d671b3

[{'created': '2018-07-23 13:13:52.000000000', 'message': 'update requirements for neutron-lib 1.18.0

Neutron-lib 1.18.0 is our Rocky RC and is already being used by neutron
[1]. This patch updates the neutron-lib required version to match
neutron [1] in prep for the Rocky release.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583671/

Change-Id: I6b81670ade7131caedcc2c0b5dddff4415554676
'}, {'created': '2018-07-24 13:03:29.000000000', 'message': 'update requirements for neutron-lib 1.18.0

Neutron-lib 1.18.0 is our Rocky RC and is already being used by neutron
[1]. This patch updates the neutron-lib required version to match
neutron [1] in prep for the Rocky release.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583671/

To work with neutron-lib 1.18.0, we need Rocky version of neutron,
so the minimum version of neutron is bumped to 13.0.0.0b2 (Rocky-2).

We also need to bump the minimum version of SQLAlchemy. Rocky neutron
depends on pending_to_persistent ORM event in SQLAlchemy which was added
in SQLAlchemy 1.1. Rocky neutron now requires SqlAlchemy>=1.2.0,
so the min version of SQLAlchemy is bumped to 1.2.0.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I6b81670ade7131caedcc2c0b5dddff4415554676
'}, {'created': '2018-07-24 13:13:07.000000000', 'message': 'update requirements for neutron-lib 1.18.0

Neutron-lib 1.18.0 is our Rocky RC and is already being used by neutron
[1]. This patch updates the neutron-lib required version to match
neutron [1] in prep for the Rocky release.

It also adds a lower constraints zuul job to ensure neutron is pulled
into the env; otherwise the errors show in PS1 results will occur.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583671/

Change-Id: I6b81670ade7131caedcc2c0b5dddff4415554676
'}]
commit_message:
update requirements for neutron-lib 1.18.0

Neutron-lib 1.18.0 is our Rocky RC and is already being used by neutron
[1]. This patch updates the neutron-lib required version to match
neutron [1] in prep for the Rocky release.

It also adds a lower constraints zuul job to ensure neutron is pulled
into the env; otherwise the errors show in PS1 results will occur.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583671/

Change-Id: I6b81670ade7131caedcc2c0b5dddff4415554676

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Hai <nguyentrihai93@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibd77a8fa492836f5892de75088fadb6515812beb
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-29 16:34:56.000000000', 'message': 'Re-enable KVM

A recent kernel update in the nodepool images has resolved the issue
we were seeing with using KVM on some hosting providers.
This patch removes the exclusion for those hosting providers and
allows the Octavia gates to use KVM if it is available on the host.

Change-Id: Ibd726a831db4988ab1820084b2683c38a852ce93
'}]
commit_message:
Re-enable KVM

A recent kernel update in the nodepool images has resolved the issue
we were seeing with using KVM on some hosting providers.
This patch removes the exclusion for those hosting providers and
allows the Octavia gates to use KVM if it is available on the host.

Change-Id: Ibd726a831db4988ab1820084b2683c38a852ce93

commit_message:
Add baseline object in the drivers update callbacks

Commit Ide4beaf73bb99be5c3b4c71c12fecef3499f45d9 updated the drivers api spec.
This patch implements the new api for the update callbacks which needs the
original objet as well.

Change-Id: I530ec49acdc249a1f29e3e366eee70e29627a047

commit_message:
Fix response status for invalid routes

Barbican should respond to invalid routes with 404 NOT FOUND
instead of 405 METHOD NOT ALLOWED.

Change-Id: I9d1b854e98f666de2ff6443fe01d5c8a8c6922b6

messages:
[{'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-07-24 08:26:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-07-24 09:14:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-07-24 09:41:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-07-24 10:15:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-07-25 07:47:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-07-25 10:01:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-07-25 11:10:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck

A potential bug in the failed job tempest tests.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-07-25 11:52:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-07-25 11:54:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

do you think is
https://github.com/openstack/qinling/blob/ce6d7e0f6415ad94221a172ad99679316a790ac4/qinling_tempest_plugin/tests/api/test_executions.py#L87 is a little dangerous? It is affecting all the related operations in qinling-engine.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-07-25 21:36:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-07-26 02:12:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> do you think is
 > https://github.com/openstack/qinling/blob/ce6d7e0f6415ad94221a172ad99679316a790ac4/qinling_tempest_plugin/tests/api/test_executions.py#L87
 > is a little dangerous? It is affecting all the related operations
 > in qinling-engine.

Not in this case, It just prevents new execution of that function being created in the engine, and the function in that test is newly created so it doesn't affect others.

From the last tempest failure, in job handler, the operations before creating an execution[1] takes an unusual period of time, 13 seconds or so[2][3]. In that case, job is marked done but the execution is not yet created. That leads to the failure.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/qinling/blob/master/qinling/services/periodics.py#L103-L159
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/73/585173/5/check/qinling-tempest/a0f3790/controller/logs/screen-qinling-api.txt.gz#_Jul_25_10_55_20_130447
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/73/585173/5/check/qinling-tempest/a0f3790/controller/logs/screen-qinling-api.txt.gz#_Jul_25_10_55_33_983538"}]

messages: [{'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-07-25 15:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-07-25 15:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 16465, 'date': '2018-07-25 15:36:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-07-25 15:37:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-25 22:30:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nreplying for tracking'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-25 15:36:16.000000000', 'message': "Reduce duplication in federated auth APIs

The GET /v3/OS-FEDERATION/projects and GET /v3/OS-FEDERATION/domains
APIs were introduced to handle tokens from federated users, but now
that GET /v3/auth/projects and GET /v3/auth/domains know how to handle
federated tokens, they're just duplicate APIs.

In the past we deprecated these federated auth APIs, but they still
used separate code paths from GET /v3/auth/projects and GET
/v3/auth/domains. The two code paths are true duplication in that they
don't expect to differ over time and should provide the same user
experience.

Instead of running the risk that comes with two code paths that do the
same thing, we should consolidate them.

Co-Authored-By: Kristi Nikolla <kristi@nikolla.me>

Closes-Bug: 1779205
Change-Id: Ib906c42e1dd2c2408ccd2e256ffd876af02af3fe
(cherry picked from commit df5d75571ed274b2964ed52048768c6d9f24d138)
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce duplication in federated auth APIs

The GET /v3/OS-FEDERATION/projects and GET /v3/OS-FEDERATION/domains
APIs were introduced to handle tokens from federated users, but now
that GET /v3/auth/projects and GET /v3/auth/domains know how to handle
federated tokens, they're just duplicate APIs.

In the past we deprecated these federated auth APIs, but they still
used separate code paths from GET /v3/auth/projects and GET
/v3/auth/domains. The two code paths are true duplication in that they
don't expect to differ over time and should provide the same user
experience.

Instead of running the risk that comes with two code paths that do the
same thing, we should consolidate them.

Co-Authored-By: Kristi Nikolla <kristi@nikolla.me>

Closes-Bug: 1779205
Change-Id: Ib906c42e1dd2c2408ccd2e256ffd876af02af3fe
(cherry picked from commit df5d75571ed274b2964ed52048768c6d9f24d138)

[{'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2018-07-25 02:32:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-07-25 02:32:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 19055, 'date': '2018-07-25 11:50:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13111, 'date': '2018-07-26 01:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13111, 'date': '2018-07-26 01:07:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Support Watcher HA active-active Mode

Watcher-decision-engine and Applier currently don't support
HA active-active mode.
If we enable more than one Watcher-decision-engine, the question is
how to know the relation between audit and Watcher-decision-engine.
We can add a new 'host' field in the audit table to solve
this question. When we update the audit sate from PENDING
to ONGOING, we record the host into the 'host' field.

Change-Id: I355e478bb0171a67bde8b95468e193e274c1fd0c
Implements: blueprint support-watcher-ha-active-active-mode

[{'created': '2018-07-06 21:52:43.000000000', 'message': "cleanup mapping/reqspec after archive instance

This patch aims at deleting the records of the archived instances from
the instance_mappings and request_specs tables in the API database
immediately following their archival from instances to shadow_instances
table. So upon running the 'nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows' command
the records of the archived instances will be automatically removed from
the instance_mappings and request_specs tables as well. A warning has
also been added to fix the issue of 'nova-manage verify_instance'
returning a valid instance mapping even after the instance is deleted.

The patch also adds InstanceMappingList.destory_bulk() and
RequestSpec.destroy_bulk() methods for ease of bulk deletion of records.

Change-Id: I483701a55576c245d091ff086b32081b392f746e
Closes-Bug: #1724621
Closes-Bug: #1678056
(cherry picked from commit 32fd58813f8247641a6b574b5f01528b29d48b76)
"}]
commit_message:
cleanup mapping/reqspec after archive instance

This patch aims at deleting the records of the archived instances from
the instance_mappings and request_specs tables in the API database
immediately following their archival from instances to shadow_instances
table. So upon running the 'nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows' command
the records of the archived instances will be automatically removed from
the instance_mappings and request_specs tables as well. A warning has
also been added to fix the issue of 'nova-manage verify_instance'
returning a valid instance mapping even after the instance is deleted.

The patch also adds InstanceMappingList.destory_bulk() and
RequestSpec.destroy_bulk() methods for ease of bulk deletion of records.

Change-Id: I483701a55576c245d091ff086b32081b392f746e
Closes-Bug: #1724621
Closes-Bug: #1678056
(cherry picked from commit 32fd58813f8247641a6b574b5f01528b29d48b76)

commit_message:
Enhance Watcher applier Engine

For linked actions, the execution of an action depends on the
result of previous action.

Change-Id: I5d5013bd39ddc827aaee9880e8de5c9b6c35c392
Implements: blueprint enhance-watcher-applier-engine

LB support UDP - Client part

As current Octavia client design is good for this feature. So this patch
just add the UDP fields into the support list.

messages:
[{'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-07-05 08:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-07-05 09:11:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

- provider

Please also include a release note.'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-07-06 02:14:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > Thank you for picking up the story!
 > 
 > If possible, please also add support for:
 > 
 > - vip port id
 > - provisioning status
 > - operating status
 > - provider
 > 
 > Please also include a release note.

Done, thanks.'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-07-06 02:14:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-07-06 02:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-07-06 02:32:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-07-08 08:40:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Thanks so much for picking up this story.
I have tested this, here are my comments:
1. It didn't work for me; I did not see anything about the filter I tried to apply in the request body, see line#46 here[1]. I think you should make some additions to take_action() function here[2].

2. Some filters have well-known choices.
For example: --provisioning status choices listed here[3]  and --operating-status choices listed here[4].
Argparse does support a list of choices for a given parameter, so I would use that to expose the valid choices in our client so typos and wrong entries will get filtered in the client side.  There are few examples for this in the code. See [5][6].

P.S.
When you allow options, those should accept both upper and lower cases (and convert to upper case by the client), for reference see[7].

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/725298/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580322/4/octaviaclient/osc/v2/load_balancer.py@250
[3] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/#provisioning-status-codes
[4] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/#operating-status-codes
[5] https://github.com/openstack/python-octaviaclient/blob/c606a1da7237621edeebc76eb42fe6acbce24b43/octaviaclient/osc/v2/health_monitor.py#L58-L64
[6] https://github.com/openstack/python-octaviaclient/blob/3c6213ebeb878520496284af3acb3786f3a62c38/octaviaclient/osc/v2/member.py#L128
[7] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525791/"}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-07-10 04:02:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Thanks so much for picking up this story.
 > I have tested this, here are my comments:
 > 1. It didn't work for me; I did not see anything about the filter I
 > tried to apply in the request body, see line#46 here[1]. I think
 > you should make some additions to take_action() function here[2].
 > 
 > 2. Some filters have well-known choices.
 > For example: --provisioning status choices listed here[3]  and
 > --operating-status choices listed here[4].
 > Argparse does support a list of choices for a given parameter, so I
 > would use that to expose the valid choices in our client so typos
 > and wrong entries will get filtered in the client side.  There are
 > few examples for this in the code. See [5][6].
 > 
 > P.S.
 > When you allow options, those should accept both upper and lower
 > cases (and convert to upper case by the client), for reference
 > see[7].
 > 
 > [1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/725298/
 > [2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580322/4/octaviaclient/osc/v2/load_balancer.py@250
 > [3] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/#provisioning-status-codes
 > [4] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/#operating-status-codes
 > [5] https://github.com/openstack/python-octaviaclient/blob/c606a1da7237621edeebc76eb42fe6acbce24b43/octaviaclient/osc/v2/health_monitor.py#L58-L64
 > [6] https://github.com/openstack/python-octaviaclient/blob/3c6213ebeb878520496284af3acb3786f3a62c38/octaviaclient/osc/v2/member.py#L128
 > [7] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525791/

Thanks for your review, I will fix these problems in the next patch."}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-07-10 04:02:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-07-11 10:07:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-07-11 11:24:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-07-12 04:48:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Thanks so much for picking up this story.
 > I have tested this, here are my comments:
 > 1. It didn't work for me; I did not see anything about the filter I
 > tried to apply in the request body, see line#46 here[1]. I think
 > you should make some additions to take_action() function here[2].
 > 
 > 2. Some filters have well-known choices.
 > For example: --provisioning status choices listed here[3]  and
 > --operating-status choices listed here[4].
 > Argparse does support a list of choices for a given parameter, so I
 > would use that to expose the valid choices in our client so typos
 > and wrong entries will get filtered in the client side.  There are
 > few examples for this in the code. See [5][6].
 > 
 > P.S.
 > When you allow options, those should accept both upper and lower
 > cases (and convert to upper case by the client), for reference
 > see[7].
 > 
 > [1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/725298/
 > [2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580322/4/octaviaclient/osc/v2/load_balancer.py@250
 > [3] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/#provisioning-status-codes
 > [4] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/#operating-status-codes

 > [7] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525791/

commit_message:
Add some filter options to load balancer list command

This patch adds the following options: '--vip-network-id',
'--vip-subnet-id', '--vip-qos-policy-id', '--vip-port-id',
'--provisioning-status', '--operating-status', '--provider'
to load balancer list command.

Change-Id: If48529bd32771aba248f10248d2125279a7464a3
Task: 22717
Story: 2002806

Keystone: Update admin port declaration to use standard layout

This PS updates keystone, and the keystone endpoints sections to use
the same layout for port declarations as other charts.

Change-Id: I7dddabee6c74bf023da4b1cdf722a409e7475f8f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-20 06:56:22.000000000', 'message': 'Replace port 35357 with 5000

With Keystone v3, the admin (35357) and public (5000) ports are
the same and use the same keystone code paths for authentication.

This patch set replace 35357 and only uses port 5000

Change-Id: I596e3a2b29b2954bf7caef6f9408d9b2b4e890ee
'}]
commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000

With Keystone v3, the admin (35357) and public (5000) ports are
the same and use the same keystone code paths for authentication.

This patch set replace 35357 and only uses port 5000

Change-Id: I596e3a2b29b2954bf7caef6f9408d9b2b4e890ee

@Gautham, zhongjun,
I know none of these drivers makes use of metadata in setup_server(), but metadata is passed from manager.py. Passing this keyword argument in test cases just corrects the signature of setup_server(). 
If you all agree, we can correct the signature of all these test cases, else I can abandon this patch. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 15100, 'date': '2016-09-06 01:46:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Jay Mehta, the metadata default value is None in setup_server(), please see following links, so I think we not need to redefine it again. or I missing something?
https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/master/manila/share/drivers/huawei/v3/connection.py#L1282

https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/master/manila/share/drivers/generic.py#L899'}, {'account_id': 16203, 'date': '2016-09-06 07:41:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think this patch is necessary.
And add a constant in huawei constants define file that only used in UT, it's a little strange."}, {'account_id': 21309, 'date': '2016-09-10 00:14:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hi Jay Mehta, the metadata default value is None in setup_server(),
 > please see following links, so I think we not need to redefine it
 > again. or I missing something?
 > https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/master/manila/share/drivers/huawei/v3/connection.py#L1282
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/master/manila/share/drivers/generic.py#L899

hi zhongjun_,
My point with this patch is that you are mocking manager.py by calling self.driver.setup_server() in unit test and so these calls should pass kwarg metadata={}, irrespective for any driver if it uses kwarg or not. The signature should not be mocked incorrectly in unit tests.
This patch corrects required arguments passed to self.driver.setup_server() in unit test.'}, {'account_id': 21309, 'date': '2016-09-12 23:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1'}, {'account_id': 18128, 'date': '2016-09-13 00:04:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Why only those three modules? There is much more such modules. If do, then do for all. But I am not sure it is required, because, no one uses it.'}, {'account_id': 21309, 'date': '2016-09-27 03:48:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Why only those three modules? There is much more such modules. If
 > do, then do for all. But I am not sure it is required, because, no
 > one uses it.

I will look for other modules where unit test are incorrectly mocking setup_server() calls. However no dependency to correct just 3 of these. It is not about requirement, if they are implemented, they should be done correctly. This patch provides that correction.'}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2016-09-27 12:48:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Jay Mehta,

I am saying that you add tests for "dead code". You could just remove this "metadata" arg. It would be more useful, because it will make code cleaner.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2016-09-27 12:50:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

We're using the metadata arg since Jay's last change in manila:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329552/15/manila/share/manager.py@479

However, I also think that this change is gratuitous."}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2016-09-27 13:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Goutham Pacha Ravi,

It is surprise for me. How come this code got it? "share-server" model has "host' attr. This the only usage of "metadata" is workaround for usage of existing attr.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2016-09-27 13:21:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So the problem there is the share server's created with the manager's 'self.host' attribute; which does not include the pool name; which jay-mehta wanted for his driver's implementation of storage pools."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2016-09-27 13:46:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Relevant bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1628102'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-07-25 22:48:35.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No updates in nearly 2 years, please revive if you disagree'}]

setup_server().

Change-Id: I41d0742683094d94a9f84a916fd10b6a10aab7f9
"}, {'created': '2016-09-12 23:10:05.000000000', 'message': "Correctly calling setup_server() calls in unit-tests

commit_message:
Correctly calling setup_server() calls in unit-tests

This patch passes keyword argument 'metadata' while calling
setup_server() in unit tests, now matching with signature of
setup_server() as defined in driver.py.

Change-Id: I41d0742683094d94a9f84a916fd10b6a10aab7f9

commit_message:
Init provider drivers at app setup

The provider drivers should be initialized at init, to allow configuration
validation, as well as allowing the drivers to perform actions at init.

Change-Id: Iaa6c4cbc65aa24f2c9bc53878226bd2e4b9ba694

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-25 16:45:28.000000000', 'message': 'fix vitrage webhook row replacement

fixes a bug that removes previous alarm state on alarm deactivate,
but fails to remove previous alarm state on alarm activate.
Can lead to an inactive alarm row not being replaced when the same
alarm activates.

Change-Id: I1dc7977d8355025d8f98c7931d0e8f765d692434
'}]
commit_message:
fix vitrage webhook row replacement

fixes a bug that removes previous alarm state on alarm deactivate,
but fails to remove previous alarm state on alarm activate.
Can lead to an inactive alarm row not being replaced when the same
alarm activates.

Change-Id: I1dc7977d8355025d8f98c7931d0e8f765d692434

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I255684ebe0c2d59c4141eeec12ac346bfcf477b2

commit_message:
Addressed TODO to change project_id to tenant_id

Now that bug 1695954 is addressed allowing the QoS policy API to
accept the 'tenant_id' filter this has been amended in the qos panel
code.

For further details on the bug requiring project_id to be used
temporarily, see https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1695954.

Change-Id: If7920a8826c9cc8dc6ba7a6f056e6e9fa34df677

commit_message:
Use tox 3.1.1 and basepython fix

tox 3.1.1 fixed https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/477 which
mishandled the basepython directive. Require this version and remove the
workarounds.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/132085.html

Change-Id: Ie9a7cdd16980c7da87ae521be4198483115ec7a2

commit_message:
Add docs for case-insensitivity in keystone

This adds a new page of documentation to describe how keystone handles
case sensitivity (or the lack of) depending on the resource and
backend used.

Change-Id: I868b43e6be7809648f9260e1b272f5626b30a95d

commit_message:
Remove unused class variables

cls.binary in ServicesAdminNegativeV253TestJSON is not used, so
this is to remove it. Besides, cls.services in
VolumeServicesNegativeTest need not be a class variable.

Change-Id: If3fcb53ff0ee5e2c608d1a675fb18600ef39dd2e
